commit_message:
Propose resource federation for block devices

Enables use of block device resources across OpenStack installations linked
with K2K authentication.  In particular, it enables the following use cases:

* Attaching and detaching remote volumes
* Booting from a remote image
* Attaching remote volumes at boot using the block-device-manager interface

Change-Id: Icc2fcfe30f466d947bc752b3e0dc93cc4187ee6b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/53/342453/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ===================================== Resource Federation for Block Devices ===================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/mix-and-match-resource-federation Problem description =================== With Keystone to Keystone (K2K) federation, users can access resources spread across multiple Openstack deployments. But, these resources can currently only interact at the application layer, and not at the infrastructure (Openstack) layer. One instance cannot have access to multiple block storage devices in separate Openstack deployments, for instance. We propose an extension of the Nova API that allows instances to access block device objects (volumes, volume snapshots, and images) in other Openstack deployments, as long as the user has access to them via K2K federation. Use Cases --------- * Collaborations between people in different Openstack deployments (e.g. groups within a company, private clouds in a colocated facility, clouds with different data security regulation) * Standing up experimental Openstack services while using resources from an existing deployment (e.g. new Nova release, testing an experimental backend) * Enabling defense-in-depth by keeping separate services in separate authentication domains Proposed change =============== For attaching volumes to an already booted instance, a 'service-provider' (or possibly 'cinder-provider' or similar) optional parameter will be added to the nova volume-attach REST API call. If the parameter is present, Nova will look up the service provider by name in the Keystone catalog and use Keystone-to-Keystone (K2K) federation to obtain a token for the remote Openstack deployment. (This takes place inside the keystoneauth1 library.) From there, Nova will query the remote Cinder for the volume details. Two parameters will be added to entries in the block-device-mapping-v2 parameter in 'nova boot': 'source-sp' and 'dest-sp', describing the location of the source image, snapshot or volume, and the location of the destination volume respectively. The following constraints apply: If 'source_type' is 'blank', then no 'source-sp' can be specified. If 'dest_type' is 'local', then no 'dest-sp' can be specified. Currently, if they are both specified, 'source-sp' and 'dest-sp' cannot be different. This could be supported in the future with additional changes to other services. An 'image-sp' optional parameter will be added to the server schema in 'nova boot'. Since the Openstack client makes a Nova API call to fetch the image details, we also modify that call to support fetching image details from a remote Glance. Since this is a GET call, the only place to put this extra informaion is the URL, so we propose using a qualified UUID format there: perhaps 'image-uuid@remote-sp' A 'service_provider' column will be added to the 'block_device_mapping' table in Nova, so that Nova can find volumes when detaching or deleting them. (There is a potential issue in using remote UUIDs here---see Alternatives for one solution to this.) The nova volume-attachment API call will return the service-provider parameter if present. The Nova client library and Openstack CLI will be changed to enable use of these APIs. There will be a new nova configuration parameter enabling these features, defaulting to off. Alternatives ------------ * To avoid performing K2K token exchange multiple times per Nova API call, the resulting token and service could be cached, mitigating the performance impact of these changes. (One option is to put it in the Request Context.) * We could support K2K mappings that are not one-to-one by having users specify the remote project name in the API: for instance, with a second optional parameter 'remote-project', and a doubly qualified UUID * Instead of using both 'source-sp' and 'destination-sp' in the BDM specification, we could use a single 'service-provider' field. This is harder to extend to the future case with multiple different service providers, but more compactly represents the existing use-cases. * Currently, per the Openstack Compute API, 'volume-detach' takes an instance UUID and an attachment UUID; but Nova currently uses the volume UUID as the attachment UUID. However, when using volumes in remote deployments, we might prefer not to trust the remote Cinder's UUID as globally unique. Therefore, we have to find a way to create globally unique attachment UUIDs without breaking the existing behavior that local volumes have attachment UUID equal to their volume UUID. To do this, we add columns 'attachment_uuid' and 'service_provider' to the block_device_mapping database table in Nova. The volume-attach call will return the attachment_uuid, rather than the volume_uuid. When attaching a local volume, 'attachment_uuid' will be the same as 'volume_uuid'; when attaching a remote volume, 'attachment_uuid' will be a fresh UUID. The nova volume-detach call then takes an attachment UUID, looks up the corresponding volume UUID and service-provider, performs K2K authentication exchange if necessary, and detaches the volume. Deleting an instance with attached volumes detaches the volumes in the same way, and deletes them if requested. * Instead of adding extra parameters to the volume-related API calls, we could use qualified UUIDs (just like in the call to get details of an image). One possible format is 'uuid@service-provider'. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- An optional parameter is added to nova volume-attach. The interpretation of the 'attachment' parameter of nova-volume detach is changed: it is now an attachment UUID rather than a volume UUID. However, in existing use cases, the two UUIDs are identical, so the behavior is the same. POST {tenant_id}/servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments { "volumeAttachment": { "volumeId": "a26887c6-c47b-4654-abb5-dfadf7d3f803", "device": "/dev/vdd" "serviceProvider": "k2k-sp1" } } Two optional parameters are added to the block-device-mapping parameter to 'nova boot'. "block_device_mapping_v2": { "boot_index": "0", "uuid": "ac408821-c95a-448f-9292-73986c790911", "source_type": "volume", "dest_type": "blank", "source_sp": "k2k-sp1" } "block_device_mapping_v2": { "boot_index": "0", "uuid": "ac408821-c95a-448f-9292-73986c790911", "source_type": "volume", "dest_type": "volume", "source_sp": "k2k-sp1", "dest_sp": "k2k-sp1" } The response to 'list volume attachments' is augmented with a 'service_provider' field: { "volumeAttachments": [ { "device": "/dev/sdd", "id": "a26887c6-c47b-4654-abb5-dfadf7d3f803", "service_provider": "k2k-sp1", "serverId": "4d8c3732-a248-40ed-bebc-539a6ffd25c0", "volumeId": "a26887c6-c47b-4654-abb5-dfadf7d3f803" } ] } Versioned API changes --------------------- In the Nova message bus RPC API, we add optional parameters to the volume attach and volume detach calls, representing the service-provider. Database changes ---------------- One new column is added to nova's block_device_mapping table: 'service_provider'. Security impact --------------- Same token exposure as in normal K2K federation. Nova-compute must have access to the storage backend in a different deployment, including both network connectivity and any necessary credentials (e.g. Ceph RBD keys). The storage backend should be deployed in such a way that the various Nova deployments that have access to it are isolated from each other. With some storage backends (e.g. RBD, but not ISCSI), Nova may be able to read all volumes in Cinder, including volumes intended to be used by a different Nova. Future changes to the Cinder RBD backend may alleviate this. Performance Impact ------------------ K2K token exchange is very slow, and, as written, will happen four or so times per relevant API call. (However, see the Alternatives section.) Other deployer impact --------------- Nova-compute must have access to the storage backend in a different deployment, including both network connectivity and any necessary credentials (e.g. Ceph RBD keys). After obtaining an unscoped token from K2K Federation, Nova will obtain a list of projects it can scope to. We require that the mapping is "one-to-one", and so there is no ambiguity as to which project to scope to. (However, see the Alternatives section.) There are some features (such as in-use volume migration) where Cinder must make calls to Nova. In the case that a remote Cinder must make a call to Nova while doing this, the call will fail. In the future, these calls could be supported by having the Cinder callbacks use a simple capability-based authentication rather than full Keystone authentication. A new Nova configuration option will let the deployers choose whether to enable this feature or disallow it entirely, in which case there is no impact at all. Developer impact ---------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None for users not using the new capabilities. For attaching new volumes, users will query the remote cinder for the UUID of the volume they want to attach. A new argument in the python-novaclient will allow users to specify the service provider. nova volume-attach --service-provider sp1 vm0 \ f089e171-a238-4a05-a7c6-a6b66f291767 Notifications impact -------------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: gsilvis Contributors: knikolla Work Items ---------- * Internal Nova changes to support API * API change with microversion * Nova client change to support microversion * Openstack client change to support microversion Dependencies ============ keystoneauth1 support in nova Testing ======= Unit test will be required to ensure that the service provider is being marshalled correctly. New tempest tests and gates will be required to make end-to-end tests. At a minimum, there will be a gate that sets up K2K federation between two devstack installations, and tests the basic volume and image functionality. Documentation Impact ==================== API examples will be modified to show the new parameters. Installation guides will talk about the deployment requirements. References ========== None

commit_message:
Remove 'reverify'

'recheck' and 'reverify' do exactly the same since
Ifbb5c67894cb436b11f69aff2d9da1140dcdaa55 from July 2014.

It's time to reverify, people are still expecting that the old behaviour
works.

Mailing list message sent to openstack-dev:

commit_message:
Rename LOCI template

Provide a shortname parameter to LOCI jobs so that the template
can be descriptive, and we end up with job names like:

  gate-loci-nova-ubuntu-xenial

Change-Id: I68ad759139517a52d2a73c3b02104aeda8275086

commit_message:
Enable functional test jobs for nova-dpm

This patch is to enable the following
functional test jobs:
 - gate-nova-dpm-tox-functional-ubuntu-xenial, and
 - gate-nova-dpm-tox-functional-py35-ubuntu-xenial
for nova-dpm

Change-Id: I8ecd2f4a3a1e365fd0737e2627ae088cb15a874a
Signed-off-by: Sreeram Vancheeswaran <sreeram.vancheeswaran@in.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Re-add magnumclient to shade's magnum job

The magnum plugin seems to want to install magnumclient from source, so
not having it here seems to be making this job very unhappy.

Change-Id: If3441ff22ed352da8c761578b0e1f041da0f56b4

commit_message:
gnocchi: remove unexisting jobs

XXXX-upgrade-from-2.2 tox targets only exist in Gnocchi >=3.1.

This change removes the associated jobs on 3.0 branch.

Change-Id: Ia9219888bc1afd8e85680c6eb87e0ec8c4534bdd

commit_message:
Promote Upgrade jobs to voting for OpenStack-Ansible

The Nova, Neutron and Cinder upgrade jobs are now working. This patch
promotes these jobs to voting for the OpenStack-Ansible roles for these
projects.

commit_message:
Fix LOCI jobs

The tarball was not being created properly [0] due to missing the
gerrit-git-prep builder that clones the repo. This patch adds in the
proper builder to these jobs.

[0] http://logs.openstack.org/4b/4b9761e7ddc74baa772e1a7d8551ee3ed41b1f68/post/loci-publish-loci-tarball/4d0b6c9/console.html#_2017-04-03_15_47_33_731809

Change-Id: Id6225e3330153a9598711b2f0ce815b242ff99e8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/46/452846/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - gerrit-git-prep - gerrit-git-prep tar cvfz {name}.tar.gz --exclude .git . mv {name}.tar.gz dist/{name}-$PROJECT_VER.tar.gz
deleted_lines: - clone-loci tar cvfz dist/{name}-$PROJECT_VER.tar.gz -C openstack/loci scripts if [[ "$ZUUL_BRANCH" == 'master' ]]; then cp dist/* dist/{name}-latest.tar.gz fi

commit_message:
py35: fixes exception.message reference issues

Python 3.5's Exception class no longer contains the
'message' attribute.

Closes-Bug: #1679183

commit_message:
[Manila] Fix building of custom image

Perform 'git' command only from root dir of appropriate repo,
to avoid influence of git repo where command is executed.

Change-Id: Ia43001d2711964f0c62285f957ec055ea5a53b4c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/26/452826/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: current_dir=$(pwd) # Go to 'manila-image-elements' dir, build image and get its name cd /opt/stack/new/manila-image-elements ./tools/gate/build-images {driver} True image_name=$(git ls-files --others --exclude-standard) # Return back to execution dir cd $current_dir

commit_message:
jjb: fix number of nodes for tripleo scenario005

When running the scenario005 with tripleo-quickstart, we still need 4
nodes like the classic tripleo-ci run that we had before. It was a
mistake and is fixed now.

Change-Id: I0605b013ba347d9a03d180bad7698e766fd4bec8

added_lines: def _test_range_header(self, method): req = Request.blank('/v/a/c', environ={'REQUEST_METHOD': method}, headers={'Range': 'bytes=0-10'}) fake_app = FakeApp() app = self.get_app(fake_app, {}) resp = req.get_response(app) self.assertEqual('200 OK', resp.status) if method is "GET": self.assertIn('Range', fake_app.req.headers) else: self.assertNotIn('Range', fake_app.req.headers) def test_range_header(self): for method in self.methods: self._test_range_header(method)

commit_message:
Change Http action result content encoding

Sometimes action result is present not in "utf-8", it cases
to "UnicodeDecodeError: 'utf8' codec can't decode byte" so
need to pass proper encoding format in serialiser and deserialiser
if it is different from default, but it should be resolved in
general as a fix for another bug (#1676411).

As a hotfix for linked bug, encoding was changed in the
run Http action method directly.

Also default encoding value in the FakeHTTPResponse was changed
from 'utf8' to 'utf-8' like in official python request lib docs.

Change-Id: I0ab9ec84c0973f362b57ab82248f27768a984678
Closes-Bug: #1667415

commit_message:
Add read-only tests for cephx access rules

In the Newton cycle the ability to create read-only rules for
cephx-backed access rules was added but there were no functional tests
to exercise this feature. This patchset adds new parameters to the
existing cephx access rule test to also test read-only rules.

Change-Id: I4b4fd5790526ebc596471fd913ffe9cdb2faa520
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/76/451576/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cls.share = cls.create_share(cls.protocol, share_network=None) @tc.attr(base.TAG_POSITIVE, base.TAG_BACKEND) @ddt.data(*itertools.product( set(['2.13', '2.27', '2.28', LATEST_MICROVERSION]), ("alice", "alice_bob", "alice bob"))) @ddt.unpack def test_create_delete_ro_cephx_rule(self, version, access_to): # Create a read-only access rule rule = self.shares_v2_client.create_access_rule( self.share["id"], self.access_type, access_to, version=version, access_level='ro') # Make sure the keys are correct and that the access rule is active self.assertEqual('ro', rule['access_level']) for key in ('deleted', 'deleted_at', 'instance_mappings'): self.assertNotIn(key, rule.keys()) self.shares_v2_client.wait_for_access_rule_status( self.share["id"], rule["id"], "active") # Delete the access rule and make sure it is deleted successfully self.shares_v2_client.delete_access_rule( self.share["id"], rule["id"], version=version) self.shares_v2_client.wait_for_resource_deletion( rule_id=rule["id"], share_id=self.share['id'])

This commits propose to keep the current scenario manager

commit_message:
Keep scenario manager temporary copy for plugins

As scenario manager class is mess and already under
refactoring, almost all the plugins use that class
for their scenario testing.

Refactoring will defiantly impact their tests and waiting
for each plugins to fix their usage on every tempest refactor
patch will leads to delay in works.

This commits propose to keep the current scenario manager
temporary copy in Tempest and work on new scenario base class
(which is copy of scenario manager in tempest) to make
it scenario tests in good shape.

Once Tempest will be done with refactoring and ready with stable
interface or helpers required for scenario testing, temporary
scenario manager class will be removed with deprecation period.

This way gives benefits like:
1. We can merge the Tempest refactoring work fast without
   breaking any plugins.
2. Plugins will switch to new helpers or stable interfaces in one shot
   instead of keep changing their usage on every tempest refactor change.

Other way is to ask each plugins to keep scenario managers local copy
but that needs changes in each plugins.

ref- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-February/112902.html

Change-Id: I941ec1e5e0f3c1ad8fb609de7ad7081ae9653967
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/91/439291/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Configure identity_uri with authtoken resource

This configuration option is used for the authentication plugin in
the authtoken middleware. It's used in favor of configuring it using the
host fragments, as referenced in the keystonemiddleware documentation.

Change-Id: I96f45b97876b8b96154490069233373eaf051556

commit_message:
Fix link to config-ref in admin-guide

The link was pointing to a wrong paragraph
in the config-reference page. The paragraph
ids are to fragile in any way, so we shouldn't
use them at all.

Change-Id: I89869d51e76d916aee7c9d38a5d4b6b4f58ce09e
Closes-Bug: #1678601

When log tin stderr, docker engine will collect the logs. It is useless
and we should write the log into file only. Then stop writing log to
stderr.

ceph-mon log location is controlled by "mon cluster log file".

Change-Id: I7883a4316420bc2bf4c772cb7248b663359f54b7
Closes-Bug: #1677237
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ceph log location

There are to parameter for ceph-mon/ceph-osd/radosgw, "-f" and "-d".

    -d run in foreground, log to stderr.
    -f run in foreground, log to usual location.

When log tin stderr, docker engine will collect the logs. It is useless
and we should write the log into file only. Then stop writing log to
stderr.

ceph-mon log location is controlled by "mon cluster log file".

Change-Id: I7883a4316420bc2bf4c772cb7248b663359f54b7
Closes-Bug: #1677237

commit_message:
Call clean_up_instance() during node teardown for Agent deploy

Agent based deploy do not call boot.clean_up_instance() during node
teardown. This is required so that instance clean up can happen as
part of node teardown.

Change-Id: I6077b69f17ce462b6aae1b16fdb40158cf111c5e
Closes-Bug: #1676321

subject: Fix OvnBaseConnection.get_schema_helper bug in some case
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-22 08:48:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/1e7eab8f7e654c5ecd4016845e762961dc4561ca', 'message': "Fix get_schema_helper bug in some case

When thread of ovn ovsdb-server is not present, then start or restart
neutron-server, manager is set to openvswitch. Neutron-server can no
longer connect to ovn ovsdb for occupied port 6641 or 6642 unless I
delete manager manually.
This bug is not always exists, it's caused by some recent neutron
modification.
Fix this bug in networking-ovn, using idlutils._get_schema_helper
instead of idlutils.get_schema_helper as a simple workaround until
openstack/ovsdbapp is ready.

Change-Id: I01a3a65f264bd7e080f9aa2c5e2482dbe07694f4

commit_message:
Fix OvnBaseConnection.get_schema_helper bug in some case

When thread of ovn ovsdb-server is not present(e.g. kill the process),
restart neutron-server and then start ovn ovsdb-server, neutron-server
can no longer connect to ovn ovsdb unless I delete ovs manager manually.
This bug is not always exists, it's caused by some recent neutron
modification. Neutron code moved Connection.get_schema_helper() logic
to idlutils.get_schema_helper()[1], the change affects OvnBaseConnection.
get_schema_helper(), because enable_connection_uri() is called again.
Use idlutils._get_schema_helper() instead of idlutils.get_schema_helper()
to fix this bug.
[1]https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/agent/ovsdb/native/connection.py#L123-L129

Change-Id: I01a3a65f264bd7e080f9aa2c5e2482dbe07694f4
Partial-Bug: #1674889
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>

When VM with floating IP associated was deleted, dnat_and_snat row in
OVN_Northbound DB was not removed. Then delete this floating IP,
dnat_and_snat is still in OVN DB.
Currently a workaround in _update_floating_ip_in_ovn is, when
re-associating, getting the list of nat rules and checking if the
external_ip with type 'dnat_and_snat' already exists or not. If exists,
set the new value.
However, disassociate_floatingips is the conventional approach for
l3 plugin to handle the callback of VM port' deleting, this patch

Change-Id: Ib487c00905d08e1f47f77bd4ddb2810c8ee19ea9

commit_message:
Implement disassociate_floatingips in l3_ovn.py

When VM with floating IP associated was deleted, dnat_and_snat row in
OVN_Northbound DB was not removed. Then delete this floating IP,
dnat_and_snat is still in OVN DB.
Currently a workaround in _update_floating_ip_in_ovn is, when
re-associating, getting the list of nat rules and checking if the
external_ip with type 'dnat_and_snat' already exists or not. If exists,
set the new value.
However, disassociate_floatingips is the conventional approach for
l3 plugin to handle the callback of VM port' deleting, this patch
implements the function in l3_ovn plugin.

Change-Id: Ib487c00905d08e1f47f77bd4ddb2810c8ee19ea9
Closes-Bug: #1677581
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/35/452035/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def disassociate_floatingips(self, context, port_id, do_notify=True): fips = self.get_floatingips(context.elevated(), filters={'port_id': [port_id]}) router_ids = super(OVNL3RouterPlugin, self).disassociate_floatingips( context, port_id, do_notify) for fip in fips: router_id = fip.get('router_id') fixed_ip_address = fip.get('fixed_ip_address') if router_id and fixed_ip_address: update_fip = {'logical_ip': fixed_ip_address, 'external_ip': fip['floating_ip_address']} try: self._update_floating_ip_in_ovn( context, router_id, update_fip, associate=False) self.update_floatingip_status( context, fip['id'], n_const.FLOATINGIP_STATUS_DOWN) except Exception: LOG.error(_LE('Error in disassociating floatingip %s'), fip['id']) return router_ids

Remove unnecessary setUp function in testcase

In testcase, setUp will be called automatically. This patch used to
remove setUp functions that do nothing. Besides, it will keep code clean.

commit_message:
Allow the split of install and config

If keystone install is done separately from the config (filtering
or interruption), a re-run of the role will not mark the venv
as changed, and the db sync will not trigger.

Here we force a flush on file next to the venv change, and use
this file (local fact) as a way to know if a db sync is required.

When a dbsync is considered done, i.e after the expand and migrate
stages, we mark the db_migrate as done for all the nodes.

Change-Id: I318700582a65cc1ea6571d9460fd58bed949a4e9
Depends-On: Ie4a47e85bf31e1ac3a2bd6f0dec510bb24abdbbd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone refs/changes/96/452196/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
strongswan: Use non-blocking version of ipsec up

It shouldn't block here because otherwise all vpn services
served by the agent will be affected.

Closes-Bug: #1660899
Change-Id: I479ef1f88967e371d95dfbf583a4e2b813148c6d

subject: WIP Add ability to pass execute() to get_schema_helper
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-03 16:27:00.000000000', 'files': ['ovsdbapp/native/idlutils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ovsdbapp/commit/aa75a6eb6c25208eb623efed31c3a5032f978df2', 'message': 'WIP Add ability to pass execute() to get_schema_helper

Since get_schema_helper() eventually calls enable_connection_uri,
we need to be able to pass an execute function that can handle
things like rootwrap, etc. if this is to be used. Of course, this
is deprecated in favor of passing a factory function that does all

go.

Change-Id: I626e94f95dcf858c65163e31005d5e047f133aa6
'}]
commit_message:
WIP Add ability to pass execute() to get_schema_helper

Since get_schema_helper() eventually calls enable_connection_uri,
we need to be able to pass an execute function that can handle
things like rootwrap, etc. if this is to be used. Of course, this
is deprecated in favor of passing a factory function that does all
of this outside the library so this might not be the right way to
go.

Change-Id: I626e94f95dcf858c65163e31005d5e047f133aa6

deleted_lines: def get_schema_helper(connection, schema_name, retry=True, try_add_manager=True): helpers.enable_connection_uri(connection)

commit_message:
Revert "Uninstall postfix on nodes if it's there"

This reverts commit 2b017bc5b2f2f422e8b351a84d26bec31f6d7c16.

Postfix is needed by redhat-lsb-core so this breaks centos images.

Change-Id: I9eaceefb6bd327df5d78066106ba88fe1c44c778

commit_message:
Correction in data db test cases

As per sql documents, timestamp is a string but in test cases we
are passing datetime object, which is causing failure of test,
with currnet version of sqlalchemy.

Before passing the object to query, it has been converted to
string.

Change-Id: I4d7ee2847e8df5b7ecf284ad1de8660ef1245b72
Closes-Bug: #1678280

added_lines: @staticmethod def _get_timestamp(timestamp): return timestamp.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S') def test_equal_created_at(self): created_at = self._get_timestamp(self._create_row().created_at) models.OpendaylightJournal.created_at == created_at).all() def test_compare_greater_created_at(self): created_at = self._get_timestamp(row.created_at + datetime.timedelta(minutes=1)) def test_compare_less_created_at(self): row = self._create_row() created_at = self._get_timestamp(row.created_at + datetime.timedelta(minutes=-1)) got = self.db_session.query(models.OpendaylightJournal).filter( models.OpendaylightJournal.created_at > created_at).all() self.assertEqual(1, len(got))

commit_message:
Add two response parameters in the api-ref of getting capabilities

Add "display_name" and "replication_targets" to the response parameters
in the api-ref of getting capabilities.

Change-Id: Id1776641ea9938d024906707fec2e21404668ff7
Closes-bug: #1674237

commit_message:
Allow to use a custom block device with LXD init

Also add a missing package when using LXD with LVM backend which is not
yet fully configurable, see:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1678073

Change-Id: I384a8aa7713946b349fcf34dfb7d62ae2177ae2d

commit_message:
Replaces uuid.uuid4 with uuidutils.generate_uuid()

Openstack common has a wrapper for generating uuids.
We should only use that function when generating uuids for consistency.

Fixes bug #1082248

Change-Id: I0dbd2c7e2a03f3932a963ea2196f32574d3a2306

commit_message:
Add RPC encryption key support

In the Ocata release, trove added support for encrypting the rpc
communication between the guest instances and the control plane.
These settings allow the user to specify installation specific
keys versus using the default keys.

Change-Id: Ie42d754d58e983a15b553ad8a399813c9a700344

commit_message:
Introduce neutron flavor associate, disassociate to OSC

This patch introduces network flavor associate and disassociate to
OSC. The following neutron equivalent commands are implemented in OSC:

    - neutron flavor-associate
    - neutron flavor-disassociate

Change-Id: Icba4dbf7300a36353142586359059cd6784049dc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/07/403907/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class AssociateNetworkFlavor(command.Command): """Associate network flavor to network service profile""" def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(AssociateNetworkFlavor, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( 'flavor', metavar="<flavor>", help=_("ID or name of flavor to update.") ) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): client = self.app.client_manager.network obj = client.find_flavor(parsed_args.flavor, ignore_missing=False) client.associate_flavor(obj) class DisassociateNetworkFlavor(command.Command): """Disassociate network flavor to network service profile""" def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(DisassociateNetworkFlavor, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( 'flavor', metavar="<flavor>", help=_("ID or name of flavor") ) parser.add_argument( 'service_profile', metavar="<service_profile>", help=_("ID or name of service_profile") ) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): client = self.app.client_manager.network obj_flavor = client.find_flavor( parsed_args.flavor, ignore_missing=False) obj_service_profile = client.find_service_profile( parsed_args.service_profile, ignore_missing=False) client.disassociate_flavor(obj_flavor, obj_service_profile)

commit_message:
Add IPv6 support for the Security Groups

Adds support for IPv6 rules in the security groups

Partially-implements: blueprint ipv6

Change-Id: I41334ae3ff7a6af1d3351290ddfbd027d6a79879

not support yet LOG.info(_LI("IPv6 rules are not supported yet")) else: LOG.error(_LE("wrong ethernet type")) if not netaddr.valid_ipv4(lport.get_ip()): LOG.warning(_LW("No support for non IPv4 protocol")) return return if not netaddr.valid_ipv4(lport.get_ip()): LOG.warning(_LW("No support for non IPv4 protocol")) if rule.get_ethertype() == n_const.IPv6: # added_lines: heat_template_version: ocata description: > OpenStack Ceilometer Ipmi Agent service configured with Puppet parameters: ServiceNetMap: default: {} description: Mapping of service_name -> network name. Typically set via parameter_defaults in the resource registry. This mapping overrides those in ServiceNetMapDefaults. type: json DefaultPasswords: default: {} type: json EndpointMap: default: {} description: Mapping of service endpoint -> protocol. Typically set via parameter_defaults in the resource registry. type: json RedisPassword: description: The password for the redis service account. type: string hidden: true MonitoringSubscriptionCeilometerIpmi: default: 'overcloud-ceilometer-agent-ipmi' type: string CeilometerAgentIpmiLoggingSource: type: json default: tag: openstack.ceilometer.agent.ipmi path: /var/log/ceilometer/ipmi.log resources: CeilometerServiceBase: type: ./ceilometer-base.yaml properties: ServiceNetMap: {get_param: ServiceNetMap} DefaultPasswords: {get_param: DefaultPasswords} EndpointMap: {get_param: EndpointMap} outputs: role_data: description: Role data for the Ceilometer Ipmi Agent role. value: service_name: ceilometer_agent_ipmi monitoring_subscription: {get_param: MonitoringSubscriptionCeilometerIpmi} logging_source: {get_param: CeilometerAgentIpmiLoggingSource} logging_groups: - ceilometer config_settings: map_merge: - get_attr: [CeilometerServiceBase, role_data, config_settings] - ceilometer_redis_password: {get_param: RedisPassword} ipmi_namespace: true step_config: | include ::tripleo::profile::base::ceilometer::agent::polling upgrade_tasks: - name: "PreUpgrade step0,validation: Check service openstack-ceilometer-ipmi is running" shell: /usr/bin/systemctl show 'openstack-ceilometer-ipmi' --property ActiveState | grep '\bactive\b' tags: step0,validation - name: Stop ceilometer_agent_ipmi service tags: step2 service: name=openstack-ceilometer-ipmi state=stopped

commit_message:
Remove the usage of extension black/white list opt in AZ

The Nova API doesn't support the extension anymore. The API
unittest shouldn't disable any part of Nova API. This patch
removes the tests which disable part of API in availability
zone unittests.

Partial-implement-blueprint api-no-more-extensions-pike

Change-Id: Ifed7d8caa4c4abd79c74d95ff04583eb9f6fd54f

commit_message:
Introduce LineWithFocusChart

This commit introduces the NVD3 LineWithFocusChart to the homepage. This
chart might be useful for condensed charts like the o-h. Because users
can zoom in and out charts easily.

Change-Id: I5afde5bc0c6863e245b333cc8032b48170d69204
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-health refs/changes/79/287679/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'use strict'; var directivesModule = require('./_index.js'); var d3 = require('d3'); var nv = require('nvd3'); /** * @ngInject */ function chartLineFocus() { var link = function(scope, el, attrs) { scope.$on('loading-started', function() { el.css({'display' : 'none'}); }); scope.$on('loading-complete', function() { el.css({'display' : 'block'}); }); var chart = null; var svg = d3.select(el[0]).append('svg') .attr('width', attrs.width) .attr('height', attrs.height); var update = function(data) { if (typeof data === 'undefined') { return; } chart = nv.models.lineWithFocusChart() .margin({ left: 50, right: 50 }) .useInteractiveGuideline(true); chart.tooltip.gravity('s').chartContainer(el[0]); chart.xAxis.tickFormat(function(d) { return d3.time.format('%x')(new Date(d)); }); chart.x2Axis.tickFormat(function(d) { return d3.time.format('%x')(new Date(d)); }); if (attrs.forceY) { chart.forceY(angular.fromJson(attrs.forceY)); } if (attrs.tickFormatX) { chart.yAxis.tickFormat(d3.format(attrs.tickFormatX)); chart.y2Axis.tickFormat(d3.format(attrs.tickFormatX)); } if (attrs.tickFormatY) { chart.yAxis.tickFormat(d3.format(attrs.tickFormatY)); chart.y2Axis.tickFormat(d3.format(attrs.tickFormatY)); } svg.datum(data).call(chart); }; scope.$on('windowResize', function() { if (chart !== null) { chart.update(); } }); scope.$watch('data', update); }; return { restrict: 'EA', scope: { 'data': '=', 'width': '@', 'height': '@' }, link: link }; } directivesModule.directive('chartLineFocus', chartLineFocus);

commit_message:
Update ubuntu_override tweak for systemd

Change-Id: I81870293cb607b0c19eb8cb28f8f99902eed9d6a
blueprint: mos-xenial
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/57/349257/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if $::service_provider == 'systemd' { # Use 'systemd' mask / unmask to disable service actions $systemd_service_file = "/etc/systemd/system/${service_name}.service" ensure_resource('file', "create-override-${service_name}", { ensure => link, path => $systemd_service_file, target => '/dev/null' }) ensure_resource('exec', "remove-override-${service_name}", { path => [ '/sbin', '/bin', '/usr/bin', '/usr/sbin' ], command => "rm -f ${systemd_service_file}", onlyif => "test -L ${systemd_service_file}", }) } else { # Use 'sysvinit' policy-rc.d mechanism. # This will not work with upstart if using commands like 'service xxx start' # It was here before so using it as a kind of default. # https://people.debian.org/~hmh/invokerc.d-policyrc.d-specification.txt # use policy-rc.d to really ensure services don't get started on # installation as service override files are only used if a job # configuration file exists (see man 5 init) $policyrc_file = '/usr/sbin/policy-rc.d' # use ensure resource as we only want a single instance of the # policy-rc.d file in the catalog ensure_resource('file', "create-override-${service_name}", { ensure => present, path => $policyrc_file, content => "#!/bin/bash\nexit 101", mode => '0755', owner => 'root', group => 'root' }) # use ensure resource as we only want a single remove exec in the catalog ensure_resource('exec', "remove-override-${service_name}", { path => [ '/sbin', '/bin', '/usr/bin', '/usr/sbin' ], command => "rm -f ${policyrc_file}", onlyif => "test -f ${policyrc_file}", }) } File["create-override-${service_name}"] -> Exec["remove-override-${service_name}"] File["create-override-${service_name}"] -> Exec["remove-override-${service_name}"] Exec["remove-override-${service_name}"] -> Exec["remove-override-${service_name}"] ->
deleted_lines: # https://people.debian.org/~hmh/invokerc.d-policyrc.d-specification.txt # use policy-rc.d to really ensure services don't get started on # installation as service override files are only used if a job # configuration file exists (see man 5 init) $policyrc_file = '/usr/sbin/policy-rc.d' # use ensure resource as we only want a single instance of the # policy-rc.d file in the catalog ensure_resource('file', 'create-policy-rc.d', { ensure => present, path => $policyrc_file, content => "#!/bin/bash\nexit 101", mode => '0755', owner => 'root', group => 'root' }) # use ensure resource as we only want a single remove exec in the catalog ensure_resource('exec', 'remove-policy-rc.d', { path => [ '/sbin', '/bin', '/usr/bin', '/usr/sbin' ], command => "rm -f ${policyrc_file}", onlyif => "test -f ${policyrc_file}", }) File['create-policy-rc.d'] -> Exec['remove-policy-rc.d'] File['create-policy-rc.d'] -> Exec['remove-policy-rc.d'] Exec['remove-policy-rc.d'] -> Exec['remove-policy-rc.d'] ->

Update Network Guide: Config Auto Allocation

Update commands to reflect OSC Commands.
Commands are dependent on OSC patch targeted for Ocata.

commit_message:
Add Identity v3 API varibales to the designate example section.

The example provided for the designate section in neutron.conf is missing
keystone v3 parameters. If the OpenStack deployment is using keystone
v3 API then the current set of variables as shown in the example will
not be enough and neutron-server will complain about the missing keystone
variables.

Change-Id: Ic9a386f50812f89903f9b35fdfddb6e9850583fd

commit_message:
blueprint for adding an explicit health monitor port

Change-Id: I6af4d74102154f80f24b41829cf9023a78be9a04
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-specs refs/changes/05/450505/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =================================== LBaaS Alternative Monitoring Port =================================== Problem Description =================== In the current state, the monitoring port is derived from the protocol port of load balancer's pool members. In some use cases it would be desirable to monitor a different port for the health of the load balanced members, rather than the port defined by the protocol port of the members. The use cases that where this would be desirable would be when the health monitor is available on a different port than the application, usually occurring when trying to limit access to the health diagnostic information. Due to the current state this is not possible. Proposed Change =============== When creating the monitor allow the specification of a port to run the health check against. Data Model Impact ================= The HealthMonitor data model would gain a new member variable called protocol port to store the port that the monitor will query for the health of the load balancer pool member. Rest API Impact =============== Neutron LBaaS Rest API calls having to do with Create and Update will have to accept an additonal protocol port parameter as part of the JSON payload. Security Impact =============== The security impact is minimal, if any. Horizon Impact ============== Horizon would need to be modified to allow for the specification of the port for the health monitor. It would also need to use the updated Rest API calls as well any other related UI changes to support the new port definition. Testing ======= Necessary tests will be added. Existing tests will be modified to support the change. Documentation Impact ==================== The related parts of the documentation in reference to health monitors and load balancer members will be updated align with this change. Driver Impact ============= Load balancer drivers would need to be altered to use the new health monitor protocol port in place of the member's protocol port to assess health of pool members.

subject: Fix regex for gate-puppet-openstack-integration-4..
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-14 20:01:16.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/b4be8aafa75dadc4f348c47ac0184143a8f0d7a8', 'message': "Fix regex for gate-puppet-openstack-integration-4..

The commit Ic6a7728d6789c37bb57ceea51b295050cd40d242 was wrong on its
regex, because '|' exists between 'puppet-' and 'tripleo-ci' but the
patch did put 2 parts of the job name into the separated regex.
This patch fixes the regex.

NOTE: This regex seems long and redundant, but it would be easy to
      understand what jobs are mactched to this regex. So it would

Change-Id: I51ab5380b75ce57bfdf473988be5080c7d9edb8d
"}]
commit_message:
Fix regex for gate-puppet-openstack-integration-4..

The commit Ic6a7728d6789c37bb57ceea51b295050cd40d242 was wrong on its
regex, because '|' exists between 'puppet-' and 'tripleo-ci' but the
patch did put 2 parts of the job name into the separated regex.
This patch fixes the regex.

NOTE: This regex seems long and redundant, but it would be easy to
      understand what jobs are mactched to this regex. So it would
      be useful for long-term maintenance.

Change-Id: I51ab5380b75ce57bfdf473988be5080c7d9edb8d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/39/445639/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Ensure update of the container by object-updater
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-12 14:11:15.000000000', 'files': ['swift/obj/updater.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_updater.py', 'test/probe/test_object_async_update.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/5c7988bcf0b8c86b73b45cbaf0cc0c1dd8ac8726', 'message': 'Ensure update of the container by object-updater

Object-updater regards 404 from container-server as success.
This causes wrong giving up and generates object which never appears
at container, for example when all container replicas are placed in
handoff devices at the moment.

This patch makes object-updater try updating until it gets 201s from
all container servers, and ensures the update.

Change-Id: Ic5d55ff368cec62ab2eb9fd883801ba4ab043dd4
Closes-Bug: #1328735
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure update of the container by object-updater

Object-updater regards 404 from container-server as success.
This causes wrong giving up and generates object which never appears
at container, for example when all container replicas are placed in
handoff devices at the moment.

This patch makes object-updater try updating until it gets 201s from
all container servers, and ensures the update.

Change-Id: Ic5d55ff368cec62ab2eb9fd883801ba4ab043dd4
Closes-Bug: #1328735
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/53/444653/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Fix timing test error when rebalancing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-23 02:13:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/2213702075a34dc468ce248c5a37c76cbad4075d', 'message': 'Fix timing test error when rebalancing

The reported timing can be 00:59:59 sometimes, but is still valid. This
will fail in the tests, as seen in [1].

This patch fixes this by mocking the current time, ensuring that the
first two rebalances happen at the same time.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/97/337297/32/check/gate-swift-python27-ubuntu-xenial/46203f1/console.html#_2017-02-08_07_28_42_589176

commit_message:
Fix timing test error when rebalancing

The reported timing can be 00:59:59 sometimes, but is still valid. This
will fail in the tests, as seen in [1].

This patch fixes this by mocking the current time, ensuring that the
first two rebalances happen at the same time.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/603845/

Change-Id: I0fd43d5bb13d0e88126f4f6ba14fb87faab6df9c
(cherry picked from commit 67d545e90f8046e686d3877c245b123c8b5fa58b)

commit_message:
Generate/inject instack.json if overcloud nodes

Put generate/inject instack.json under the when
overcloud_nodes clause. It can not be used
independent from that and fails if there are no
overcloud nodes defined, f.e. the containerized
undercloud use case.

Change-Id: I32b42550b9b91ed1a1b0b53ef68920938232e75b
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix tempest gate on stable/newton

This is a combination of 3 commits.

The first commit's message is:

Drop localrc references

devstack-gate supports local.conf over localrc now:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/326585/

This broke our tempest check, so dropping the only element filling
localrc file (sourcing devstackgaterc is needed all the time anyway to
get the DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX variable)

Change-Id: I9ee5e18cc5c879de500517e9c663ce99d01218d6
Closes-Bug: 1667485
(cherry picked from commit f081f642525b6027f1cad114d3d835bfd507e7dc)

This is the 2nd commit message:

Be explicit about the extensions being tested

Otherwise there the danger of skipping those important for SFC [1]

Co-Authored-By: Ihar Hrachyshka <ihrachys@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sean Dague <sean@dague.net>
Original-Commit: Ibd0f67f9131e7f67f3a4a62cb6ad28bf80e11bbf

Needed-By: Ie995f6875a1e2b4c1e47a6596d7e84d9d72c768b
[1] http://logs.openstack.org/11/442111/2/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-networking-sfc-ubuntu-xenial/0d87aca/console.html#_2017-03-07_20_40_34_903985

Change-Id: I4a51e25b7fc3c39beea69433e3230838ae2f65bc
(cherry picked from commit 5cb1e424c9c38bfd75dd2f086ca6e21ee111ec42)

This is the 3rd commit message:

Add all extensions to the tempest run

The post hook runs full tempest as well.

Change-Id: I19e4df1b26b05f08d0d770e2cbfebff6e7e91270
(cherry picked from commit 2a4a9e1e985821129b91352631b7c5037af28bc0)

commit_message:
Fix novaclient creation for ocata and later.

novaclient.client.Client's positional args changed in 7.0.0 (ocata),
breaking this charm. This commit changes the client to use
keystoneauth1 based session authentication to work around that issue.

Change-Id: I1f8a2c872850daf2f5796d0c9f6f7d52e4c075e6
Closes-bug: #1671619
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-tempest refs/changes/89/452989/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import keystoneauth1.identity.v2 as keystoneauth1_v2 import keystoneauth1.session as keystoneauth1_session def get_nova_client(self): if not self.keystone_session: auth = keystoneauth1_v2.Password( auth_url=self.keystone_auth_url(), username=self.keystone_info['service_username'], password=self.keystone_info['service_password'], tenant_name=self.keystone_info['service_tenant_name']) self.keystone_session = keystoneauth1_session.Session(auth=auth) return novaclient_client.Client( 2, session=self.keystone_session) nova_client = self.get_nova_client()
deleted_lines: if self.keystone_session: nova_client = novaclient_client.Client( 2, session=self.keystone_session) else: nova_client = novaclient_client.Client( 2, self.keystone_info['service_username'], self.keystone_info['service_password'], self.keystone_info['service_tenant_name'], self.keystone_auth_url(), )

commit_message:
Add novalink apt key and repo before installation

The novalink apt key and repo were not being added until after the
pvm-novalink apt installation. This moves those steps to a new playbook
that will run before the apt installation when using the powervm driver
type.

Change-Id: I13588aecd7e3dfe31502956846a75fafd96d1afd
Closes-Bug: #1675913

commit_message:
Add redirect for shade docs

As part of the governance move, shade started publishing its docs at
docs.o.o/developer/shade instead of docs.o.o/infra/shade. Add a redirect
in case anyone has a link to the old location so that they don't get
stale content.

Change-Id: I7d62bd877d4f29dd496daff0db0aae58d439a054
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/40/452740/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Redirecting infra docs links to new developer location redirect 301 "^/infra/shade.*$" /developer/shade$1

commit_message:
Drop py34 target in setup.cfg

1.What is the problem?
We support py35 now, so it's no need to keep the supoort for
py34. Please see [1].

2.What is the solution to the problem?
Remove support for py34 in setup.cfg.

3.What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
to realize the solution?
None

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/349069/

Change-Id: I1bf4280b0ecd040847e5f68f711f611db342843f

subject: Retrieve fresh network DB data before getting it in ml2
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-13 08:49:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/288d2b07731c2fd8dba9a536eaee7eb1851abf10', 'message': 'Expire network db data before getting it in ml2

The db objects that have join relationship with network, will be
acquired once during a DB transaction. If they are updated after the
first acquisition, the network db model object will always has stale
value of them, which is empty in the case of reported bug.

After cd7d63bde92e47a4b7bd4212b2e6c45f08c03143, the updated network
will be got from db. This causes the reported bug.

This patch expires the network db model, so that the latest data can
be got in next query.

Change-Id: Ic8935008515bed687ad3abd00c8ccaf656a30452
Closes-Bug: #1649503
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-29 08:13:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/99c2ea7d4ec599f74eb1b4a222bfbad12d3c6aa5', 'message': 'Retrieve fresh network DB data before getting it in ml2

The DB objects that have join relationship with network, will be
acquired once during a DB transaction.
However, if they are updated after the first acquisition, the network
DB model object maintains the older value, and doesnt update it.

After cd7d63bde92e47a4b7bd4212b2e6c45f08c03143, the updated network
is retrieved from the db causing this bug.
This patch retrieves the latest data for these DB objects so that
updated information can be used.

Co-Authored-By: Reedip Banerjee<reedip14@gmail.co>

commit_message:
Retrieve fresh network DB data before getting it in ml2

The DB objects that have join relationship with network, will be
acquired once during a DB transaction.
However, if they are updated after the first acquisition, the network
DB model object maintains the older value, and doesnt update it.

After cd7d63bde92e47a4b7bd4212b2e6c45f08c03143, the updated network
is retrieved from the db causing this bug.
This patch retrieves the latest data for these DB objects so that
updated information can be used.

Change-Id: Ic8935008515bed687ad3abd00c8ccaf656a30452
Closes-Bug: #1649503

added_lines: # run the reconstructor on the handoffs nodes, if there are no data # frags to hint at the node index - each hnode syncs to all primaries for hnode in hnodes: self.reconstructor.once(number=self.config_number(hnode)) # because not all primaries are online, the tombstones remain for hnode in hnodes: try: self.direct_get(hnode, opart) except direct_client.DirectClientException as err: self.assertEqual(err.http_status, 404) self.assertEqual(err.http_headers['X-Backend-Timestamp'], delete_timestamp) else: self.fail('Found obj data on %r' % hnode) # ... but it's on the first failed (now repaired) primary # ... but still on the second handoff node try: self.direct_get(hnodes[1], opart) except direct_client.DirectClientException as err: self.assertEqual(err.http_status, 404) self.assertEqual(err.http_headers['X-Backend-Timestamp'], delete_timestamp) else: self.fail('Found obj data on %r' % hnodes[1]) # ... until it's next sync # ... then it's tombstone is pushed off too!
deleted_lines: # run the reconstructor on the *second* handoff node self.reconstructor.once(number=self.config_number(hnodes[1])) # make sure it's tombstone remained try: self.direct_get(hnodes[1], opart) except direct_client.DirectClientException as err: self.assertEqual(err.http_status, 404) self.assertEqual(err.http_headers['X-Backend-Timestamp'], delete_timestamp) else: self.fail('Found obj data on %r' % hnodes[1]) # ... and it's on the first failed (now repaired) primary # run the reconstructor on the *second* handoff node # make sure it's tombstone was pushed out

commit_message:
Add None value to service.description attribute

When using kolla_keystone_service module, if
description attribute is not created(example Keystone).
Service update will fail due missing attribute.

This change adds a None value to description in order to
allow service update when description was not added.

Change-Id: I568db4559428525ac6c5083cfc20cffc20be6342

commit_message:
Fix novaclient creation for ocata and later.

novaclient.client.Client's positional args changed in 7.0.0 (ocata),
breaking this charm. This commit changes the client to use keystoneauth1
based session authentication to work around that issue.

Closes: 1671619

Change-Id: I1d84f38583072d182720a1b24b15a56d83c9b40d

commit_message:
Set default domain for all keystone users

The resource Keystone::Resource::Service_identity gets a parameter
called default_domain. This parameter comes into effect if no user or
project domain have been specified. So it's a good way to get all the
kesytone services to use this domain. The aforementioned resource is in
charge of creating the relevant keystone users, roles, services and
endpoints for OpenStack services.

Change-Id: Ic2e6fe9503a0af5fd652a5cbf25262bd705e3951

commit_message:
Replace hardcoded regions by hiera call

Some settings of the region were hardcoded and some were not. This uses
calls instead to make it uniform.

Change-Id: I8f8e234ab480fd9412f1cfb7bfd9f3d5c41f2bc1

commit_message:
[WIP] [Docs] Handle RHEL 7 STIG renumbering

This patch gets the docs adjusted to work with the new RHEL 7 STIG
version 1 release. The new STIG release has changed all of the
numbering, but it maintains a link to (most) of the old STIG IDs in
the XML.

Related-bug: 1676865
Change-Id: I1f0dcd0fe99a54bf5a92994de583225b1fdb8558

commit_message:
Log the correct request type of a subrequest downstream of copy

Before this change, subrequests made while servicing a copy would
result in logging the request type from the copy PUT/GET request
instead of the type from the subrequest being logged.

In order to have the correct requst type logged for subrequests:
- Changed subrequest environments to not inherit the orig_req_method
  of the enclosing request.
- Changed copy to be more picky about when it sets orig_req_method

In addition, subrequest environments will no longer inherit the
swift.log_info from the enclosing request.  That inheritance had
been added at Ic96a92e938589a2f6add35a40741fd062f1c29eb
along with swift.orig_req_method.

Change-Id: I1ccb2665b6cd2887659e548e55a26aa00de879e3
Closes-Bug: #1657246

deleted_lines: def test_object_delete_pass_through(self): self.app.register('DELETE', '/v1/a/c/o', swob.HTTPOk, {}) req = Request.blank('/v1/a/c/o', method='DELETE') status, headers, body = self.call_ssc(req) self.assertEqual(status, '200 OK') self.assertEqual(len(self.authorized), 1) self.assertRequestEqual(req, self.authorized[0])

commit_message:
Correctly send 412 Precondition Failed in copy middleware

Previously in copy middleware, if a user entered an invalid destination
path with an invalid `container/object` path the server would return
a 500 Internal Server Error. However, the correct response should be
a 412 Precondition Failed. This patch updates copy so that it catches
the 412 Precondition Failed exception and returns it to the client.

Closes-Bug: #1641980

Change-Id: Ic4677ae033d05b8730c6ad1041bd9c07268e11a9

commit_message:
Check rabbitmq user at step >= 2

The rabbitmq user check is moved to step >= 2 from step >= 1. There is
no gaurantee that rabbitmq is running at step 1, especially if updating
a failed stack that never made it past step 1 to begin with.

Change-Id: I029193da4c180deff3ab516bc8dc2da14c279317
Closes-Bug: #1675194
(cherry picked from commit aa9af086f05e466e88ac2a85ecc9d39f5a6d1e2f)

subject: Add support to changing the Rabbitmq password on update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-30 10:23:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/beaaad6a5d4f7f048e1d09f9ebdc2d190c460940', 'message': "Add support to changing the Rabbitmq password on update

NOTE: When porting to stable/newton, the interface changes
are avoided by taking hiera values directly instead of parameter.

Rabbitmq Password is set on the fresh deployment, but during
update, if the password is changed, it is modified in all config
files including rabbitmq config. But the rabbitmq connection fails
because the new password is not successful applied to rabbitmq.
Setting the rabbitmq_user will invoke 'rabbitmqctl change_password'.

Scenario: The password change is applied on Step1 when configuring
Rabbitmq. Other services may be updated on different Steps. Till
other services config is updated with new rabbitmq password, and
restarted, the connections will get Access Denied response. It has
cyclic dependency. So the passwords will be changes at Step1 and
once all services are updated, the connections will work as is.

Partial-Bug: #1611704

commit_message:
Add support to changing the Rabbitmq password on update

Rabbitmq Password is set on the fresh deployment, but during
update, if the password is changed, it is modified in all config
files including rabbitmq config. But the rabbitmq connection fails
because the new password is not successful applied to rabbitmq.
Setting the rabbitmq_user will invoke 'rabbitmqctl change_password'.

Scenario: The password change is applied on Step1 when configuring
Rabbitmq. Other services may be updated on different Steps. Till
other services config is updated with new rabbitmq password, and
restarted, the connections will get Access Denied response. It has
cyclic dependency. So the passwords will be changes at Step1 and
once all services are updated, the connections will work as is.

Partial-Bug: #1611704
Change-Id: I44865af3d5eb2d37eb648ac7227277e86c8fbc54
(cherry picked from commit 76931e535c69ab437c4710dc749bc363f4533ea5)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/42/451742/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $rabbitmq_pass = hiera('rabbitmq::default_pass') $rabbitmq_user = hiera('rabbitmq::default_user') $stack_action = hiera('stack_action') # In case of HA, starting of rabbitmq-server is managed by pacemaker, because of which, a dependency # to Service['rabbitmq-server'] will not work. Sticking with UPDATE action. if $stack_action == 'UPDATE' { # Required for changing password on update scenario. Password will be changed only when # called explicity, if the rabbitmq service is already running. rabbitmq_user { $rabbitmq_user : password => $rabbitmq_pass, provider => 'rabbitmqctl', admin => true, } }

commit_message:
Change noauth strategy for plugin loading

Don't do it.

os-client-config's plugin loading has been causing this pain for a long
time, removing the KSC hack-around in o-c-c unmasked this again.  So when
auth is not reuired, just don't let o-c-c do any plugin loading at all.

Ever.

Of course, this shouldn't be in OSC either, but we have to do this until
the equivalent fix lands in osc-lib, is released and makes it into the
global requirements minimum version.

Depends-on: Ie68c82f7b073012685f0513b615ab1bf00bc0c3a
Change-Id: Ifdf65f3bb90fb923947a2cbe80a881d71a3fee56
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/53/450453/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(dtroyer): Move this to osc-lib, remove entire method when 1.4.0 # release is minimum version is in global-requirements # NOTE(dtroyer): If auth is not required for a command, skip # get_one_Cloud()'s validation to avoid loading plugins validate = cmd.auth_required validate=validate,
deleted_lines: # TODO(dtroyer): Move this to osc-lib # NOTE(dtroyer): If auth is not required for a command, force fake # token auth so KSA plugins are happy kwargs = {} if not cmd.auth_required: # Build fake token creds to keep ksa and o-c-c hushed kwargs['auth_type'] = 'token_endpoint' kwargs['auth'] = {} kwargs['auth']['token'] = 'x' kwargs['auth']['url'] = 'x' validate=True, **kwargs

commit_message:
Move horizon to step 3

We configure apache in step 3 so horizon should be configured at the
same time or else updates will cause horizon to be unvailable during the
update process.

Change-Id: I4032f7c24edc0ff9ed637e213870cdd3beb9a54e
Closes-Bug: #1678338
(cherry picked from commit e2928717412242faa4eb15d778f1b5c0952edc08)

added_lines: # # Copyright (C) 2017 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # require 'spec_helper' describe 'tripleo::profile::base::horizon' do shared_examples_for 'tripleo::profile::base::horizon' do let(:pre_condition) do "class { '::tripleo::profile::base::aodh': step => #{params[:step]}, oslomsg_rpc_hosts => ['localhost.localdomain'] }" end context 'with step less than 3' do let(:params) { { :step => 2 } } it 'should do nothing' do is_expected.to contain_class('tripleo::profile::base::horizon') is_expected.to_not contain_class('horizon') end end context 'with step 3' do let(:params) { { :step => 3, } } it 'should trigger complete configuration' do is_expected.to contain_class('horizon') is_expected.to contain_class('apache::mod::remoteip') is_expected.to contain_class('apache::mod::status') end end end on_supported_os.each do |os, facts| context "on #{os}" do let(:facts) do facts.merge({ :hostname => 'node.example.com' }) end it_behaves_like 'tripleo::profile::base::horizon' end end end

commit_message:
test-requirement: avoid sqlalchemy 1.1.5+

This patch is one that two patches are squashed into in
order to unbreak CI.

From sqlalchemy 1.1.5, with_variant doesn't work as expected
https://bitbucket.org/zzzeek/sqlalchemy/issues/3952/
Keep it's version under 1.1.4 until its fix
Once sqlalchemy 1.1.9 is released and requirements/upper-constraints.txt
is updated, revert this patch.

Ansn remove the definition for 0.4.5-snapshot.
As berylium 0.4.5 snapshot was deleted from ODL nexus,
This patch also adjusts related script.

Change-Id: I2dd8f30982d9deb7e24eae386e8387b1eda97448

commit_message:
Update post_test_hook to use multinode environment.

Now that a new infra job has been added to Patrole for a
multinode environment [0], the post_test_hook in Patrole
needs to be updated.

This change will still keep "fast" tests in the "fast" gates,
although they have been renamed to not have the "fast" substring;
and it will still keep "slow" tests in the "slow" gates,
although they have been renamed with "multinode" instead of "slow".

This means that tests that require multiple nodes, like migrating
a server, can be run, rather than skipped.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/450278/

Change-Id: I278695026ce273daa8cb44e9c472cf84e880a618

added_lines: DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX="(?!.*\[.*\bslow\b.*\])(^patrole_tempest_plugin\.tests\.api)" DEVSTACK_MULTINODE_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX="(?=.*\[.*\bslow\b.*\])(^patrole_tempest_plugin\.tests\.api)"# Second argument is expected to contain value indicating whether the # environment is "multinode" or not (empty string).if [[ "$TYPE" == "multinode" ]]; then $TEMPEST_COMMAND -eall-plugin -- $DEVSTACK_MULTINODE_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX --concurrency=$TEMPEST_CONCURRENCY $TEMPEST_COMMAND -eall-plugin -- $DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX --concurrency=$TEMPEST_CONCURRENCY
deleted_lines: # TODO(felipemonteiro): This regex does a negative lookahead to exclude slow # tests that contain the @test.attr(type='slow') decorator above them. Slower # tests will execute those tests in a separate gate, which will require # future modification of this script. DEVSTACK_FAST_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX="(?!.*\[.*\bslow\b.*\])(^patrole_tempest_plugin\.tests\.api)" DEVSTACK_SLOW_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX="(?=.*\[.*\bslow\b.*\])(^patrole_tempest_plugin\.tests\.api)"# Second argument is expected to contain value to indicate whether it is # a "fast' or "slow test" gate# Select Fast Gate if Type is set to 'fast', else use 'slow' gate if [[ "$TYPE" == "fast" ]]; then $TEMPEST_COMMAND -eall-plugin -- $DEVSTACK_FAST_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX --concurrency=$TEMPEST_CONCURRENCY $TEMPEST_COMMAND -eall-plugin -- $DEVSTACK_SLOW_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX --concurrency=$TEMPEST_CONCURRENCY

Deploy ec2-api test package from RDO when needed

ec2-api has its own package for tests, so we need to deploy it in order
to run Tempest tests for ec2api.

commit_message:
To reset metadata for resources when mark healthy

We reset the metadata for resources when mark healthy
in change Ibd6c18acf6f3f24cf9bf16a524127850968062bc,
but it doesn't work, because resource policy and group
inherit from multiple class, and the method
'handle_metadata_reset' actually be called now is wrong.

This patch will fix it.

Change-Id: I8583f26b6c8f6c814a00a0a38042484378fa53db
Closes-Bug: #1672596
(cherry picked from commit ebc210375eefdb06f165e85d0cea3c02b86b29ab)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/38/449438/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_policy_metadata_reset(self): t = template_format.parse(as_template) stack = utils.parse_stack(t, params=as_params) pol = self.create_scaling_policy(t, stack, 'my-policy') metadata = {'scaling_in_progress': True} pol.metadata_set(metadata) pol.handle_metadata_reset() new_metadata = pol.metadata_get() self.assertEqual({'scaling_in_progress': False}, new_metadata)

commit_message:
enable VPN support when neutron-vpnaas in devstack

This change enables ipsec VPN support when neutron_vpnass is enabled in
devstack.

Change-Id: Ia6fb1f9b23f0fbaf2531434c2cac1e317370046b
Closes-Bug:1566602
(cherry picked from commit 7b1515348e015d42e70c256dccfb00a92edf1cd9)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/astara refs/changes/97/304697/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if is_service_enabled "neutron-vpnaas"; then iniset $ASTARA_CONF router ipsec_vpn True fi

commit_message:
test_basic_instance: validate fixed IP before floating IP

Otherwise connectivity check failure doesn't give a clue if it's a
common connectivity issue (maybe even ssh keypair not delivered), or
it's indeed address translation related.

Change-Id: I549aa99fa46942d6fb2a671be656eb7641a64c49
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/09/452909/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for addr in ( self.fip['fixed_ip_address'], self.fip['floating_ip_address']): self.check_connectivity(addr, CONF.validation.image_ssh_user, self.keypair['private_key'])

when Ironic with miltitenancy is enabled.

commit_message:
[Multitenancy] Add ironic_provision_network checkbox

This patch adds ironic_provision_network checkbox to Openstack Services tab.
The checkbox is added if Ironic component is enabled.
It is a trigger to configure separate provision network for baremetal nodes.

Related-Bug: #1588380
Change-Id: I83aea95f84f18e01c29debd2f57a557496c437ad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/95/324395/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ironic_settings: metadata: label: "Ironic Settings" weight: 40 group: "openstack_services" restrictions: - condition: "settings:additional_components.ironic.value == false" message: "Ironic is not enabled on the Additional Components section" action: "hide" ironic_provision_network: value: false label: "Use separate provisioning network" description: "If selected Ironic instance will be provisioned in separate network." weight: 10 type: "checkbox"

commit_message:
Enable to add/remove port to/from a server

This change enables to add/remove a specific port to/from a server using
the new commands:

 openstack server add port <vm> <port>
 openstack server remove port <vm> <port>

Closes-Bug: #1678137
Change-Id: I6ee57df089235ccc1fb9d38316bd484956b1134d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/28/452328/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class AddPort(command.Command): _description = _("Add port to server") def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(AddPort, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( "server", metavar="<server>", help=_("Server (name or ID) to add the port to"), ) parser.add_argument( "port", metavar="<port>", help=_("Port (name or ID) to add to the server"), ) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): compute_client = self.app.client_manager.compute server = utils.find_resource( compute_client.servers, parsed_args.server) if self.app.client_manager.is_network_endpoint_enabled(): network_client = self.app.client_manager.network port_id = network_client.find_port( parsed_args.port, ignore_missing=False).id else: port_id = parsed_args.port server.interface_attach(port_id=port_id, net_id=None, fixed_ip=None) class RemovePort(command.Command): _description = _("Remove port from server") def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(RemovePort, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( "server", metavar="<server>", help=_("Server (name or ID) to remove the port from"), ) parser.add_argument( "port", metavar="<port>", help=_("Port (name or ID) to remove from the server"), ) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): compute_client = self.app.client_manager.compute server = utils.find_resource( compute_client.servers, parsed_args.server) if self.app.client_manager.is_network_endpoint_enabled(): network_client = self.app.client_manager.network port_id = network_client.find_port( parsed_args.port, ignore_missing=False).id else: port_id = parsed_args.port server.interface_detach(port_id)

commit_message:
Change config manifest

Config manifest changed after init commit according to freezer
project requirements.

Change-Id: Ibbfbacf105babb6115861a88f415cca7d15bff76
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-freezer refs/changes/49/452749/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'spec_helper' describe 'freezer::config' do let(:config_hash) do { 'DEFAULT/foo' => { 'value' => 'fooValue' }, 'DEFAULT/bar' => { 'value' => 'barValue' }, 'DEFAULT/baz' => { 'ensure' => 'absent' } } end shared_examples_for 'freezer_config' do let :params do { :freezer_config => config_hash } end it 'configures arbitrary freezer-config configurations' do is_expected.to contain_freezer_config('DEFAULT/foo').with_value('fooValue') is_expected.to contain_freezer_config('DEFAULT/bar').with_value('barValue') is_expected.to contain_freezer_config('DEFAULT/baz').with_ensure('absent') end end shared_examples_for 'freezer_api_paste_ini' do let :params do { :api_paste_ini_config => config_hash } end it 'configures arbitrary freezer-api-paste-ini configurations' do is_expected.to contain_freezer_api_paste_ini('DEFAULT/foo').with_value('fooValue') is_expected.to contain_freezer_api_paste_ini('DEFAULT/bar').with_value('barValue') is_expected.to contain_freezer_api_paste_ini('DEFAULT/baz').with_ensure('absent') end end on_supported_os({ :supported_os => OSDefaults.get_supported_os }).each do |os,facts| context "on #{os}" do let (:facts) do facts.merge!(OSDefaults.get_facts()) end it_configures 'freezer_config' it_configures 'freezer_api_paste_ini' end end end

revisions:

Deploy ec2-api test package from RDO when needed

ec2-api has its own package for tests, so we need to deploy it in order
to run Tempest tests for ec2api.

commit_message:
Clean up deprecated items supposed to be removed in Ocata and Pike

* Support for disabling UEFI in inspector
* Authtoken signing_dir argument
* ironic::drivers::deploy manifest
* ironic::db::inspector_sync manifest
* enabled_drivers and rabbit_user from init manifest

This change leaves out the following deprecation
* Implicit including of ironic::pxe in inspector (due to unclear CI problems)
* Other rabbit_* parameters (THT still uses them, sigh)

Change-Id: Ibf1c64bb5a6538610dfd9529526f203374b4e7da

Ensure role when to assigning a role for a service user to a project

This makes sure that the role exists when wanting to assign a service
user to a role in a project.

This patch is causing internal jobs that unpack a custom role to fail when quickstart is run the second time (which we do in CI).  Per discussion with Sagi posting a revert for this until we can figure out the right solution.

'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Install requirements with pip update"

This reverts commit 4dd7b70670d7c0c98b8dcd4aeb42252f9e49aaf2.

This patch is causing internal jobs that unpack a custom role to fail when quickstart is run the second time (which we do in CI).  Per discussion with Sagi posting a revert for this until we can figure out the right solution.

This is blocking all rdophase2 internal jobs.

Change-Id: I1e8809e0adebad8c731cc42b6b5dac6530970771

commit_message:
Fix block-device-mapping when volume_size is empty

The Nova API responds with an validation error when a bdm is submitted
containing an empty volume_size. So instead omit that attribute when it
is empty.

Change-Id: Iba905fca8c440a03e828c20922f3b813bba3fa3a
Closes-Bug: 1677236

commit_message:
Introduce Octavia v2 API for Members

This patch aligns Octavia v2 API for members with
lbaasv2.

GET all - /v2.0/lbaas/pools/<pool-id>/members
GET one - /v2.0/lbaas/pools/<pool-id>/members/<member-id>
POST - /v2.0/lbaas/pools/<pool-id>/members {<body>}
PUT - /v2.0/lbaas/pools/<pool-id>/members/<member-id> {<body>}
DELETE - /v2.0/lbaas/pools/<pool-id>/members/<member-id>

Also fixes a few bugs from previous API commits and refactors
some test code / adds missing tests.

Note: This changes the default operating_status of Members from OFFLINE
to NO_MONITOR in the *v1* API, if the pool has no Health Monitor.
I see this as a bug fix.

Co-Authored-By: Nakul Dahiwade <nakul.dahiwade@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Adam Harwell <flux.adam@gmail.com>

Partially-Implements: #1616642
Closes-Bug: #1678330
Closes-Bug: #1678336
Closes-Bug: #1678337
Change-Id: I0e15ab70afd5bbbc8b94db0dc9e64f13146003e8

added_lines: # Copyright 2014 Rackspace # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import logging from oslo_config import cfg from pecan import rest from stevedore import driver as stevedore_driver from octavia.common import data_models from octavia.common import exceptions from octavia.db import repositories from octavia.i18n import _LE CONF = cfg.CONF LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class BaseController(rest.RestController): def __init__(self): super(BaseController, self).__init__() self.repositories = repositories.Repositories() self.handler = stevedore_driver.DriverManager( namespace='octavia.api.handlers', name=CONF.api_handler, invoke_on_load=True ).driver @staticmethod def _convert_db_to_type(db_entity, to_type, children=False): """Converts a data model into a Octavia WSME type :param db_entity: data model to convert :param to_type: converts db_entity to this time """ if isinstance(to_type, list): to_type = to_type[0] def _convert(db_obj): return to_type.from_data_model(db_obj, children=children) if isinstance(db_entity, list): converted = [_convert(db_obj) for db_obj in db_entity] else: converted = _convert(db_entity) return converted @staticmethod def _get_db_obj(session, repo, data_model, id): """Gets an object from the database and returns it.""" db_obj = repo.get(session, id=id) if not db_obj: LOG.exception(_LE("{name} {id} not found").format( name=data_model._name(), id=id)) raise exceptions.NotFound( resource=data_model._name(), id=id) return db_obj def _get_db_lb(self, session, id): """Get a load balancer from the database.""" return self._get_db_obj(session, self.repositories.load_balancer, data_models.LoadBalancer, id) def _get_db_listener(self, session, id): """Get a listener from the database.""" return self._get_db_obj(session, self.repositories.listener, data_models.Listener, id) def _get_db_pool(self, session, id): """Get a pool from the database.""" return self._get_db_obj(session, self.repositories.pool, data_models.Pool, id) def _get_db_member(self, session, id): """Get a member from the database.""" return self._get_db_obj(session, self.repositories.member, data_models.Member, id) def _get_db_l7policy(self, session, id): """Get a L7 Policy from the database.""" return self._get_db_obj(session, self.repositories.l7policy, data_models.L7Policy, id) def _get_db_l7rule(self, session, id): """Get a L7 Rule from the database.""" return self._get_db_obj(session, self.repositories.l7rule, data_models.L7Rule, id)

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: I24ca32d9e92cdd2b3a91916337839d116e335084

Ocata updates

This changeset contains updates for Ocata.

Notable changes include:
- Placement API added
- cell database added
- Reduced RAM use (fewer processes per service)
