commit_message:
Add help commands withouth auth in functional

A special scenairo is that users want to check the commands
help message, but don't set authentication info at all. Add
a related functional test case to cover it.

Change-Id: I7b09701df24d6f6dfcf369f89212f72e753be6e4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/07/452407/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import os def test_commands_help_no_auth(self): """Check help commands without auth info.""" # Pop all auth info auth_info = {key: os.environ.pop(key) for key in os.environ.keys() if key.startswith('OS_')} raw_output = self.openstack('help network list') self.assertIn('List networks', raw_output) raw_output = self.openstack('network list --help') self.assertIn('List networks', raw_output) raw_output = self.openstack('help volume list') self.assertIn('List volumes', raw_output) raw_output = self.openstack('volume list --help') self.assertIn('List volumes', raw_output) raw_output = self.openstack('help server list') self.assertIn('List servers', raw_output) raw_output = self.openstack('server list --help') self.assertIn('List servers', raw_output) raw_output = self.openstack('help user list') self.assertIn('List users', raw_output) raw_output = self.openstack('user list --help') self.assertIn('List users', raw_output) raw_output = self.openstack('help image list') self.assertIn('List available images', raw_output) raw_output = self.openstack('image list --help') self.assertIn('List available images', raw_output) raw_output = self.openstack('help container list') self.assertIn('List containers', raw_output) raw_output = self.openstack('container list --help') self.assertIn('List containers', raw_output) # Restore auth info os.environ.update(auth_info)

commit_message:
Requirements file missing python-virtualenv

On systems where python-virtualenv is not installed, rally fails
to run. As such adding the package to requirements required for
running rally.

Change-Id: Ib95331bab90d0926750548704ac4ba7e997d72f1
Closes-Bug: #1678047

commit_message:
Enable boot mode detection by ironic-inspector

Currently, inspection works automatically in all boot modes. However, deployment
requires UEFI to be explicitly enabled on nodes. This change enables
ironic-inspector to provide boot_mode capability based on actual boot mode.

Note that proper UEFI support still requires flavor changes.

Change-Id: I808eb5c0b92b0b84ad7fc2c49f94aa675fc64dde
Closes-Bug: #1675052

commit_message:
Re-Add bigswitch agent support

The agent configuration was lost in newton during the puppet-tripleo and
THT role conversion. This change adds support for including the bigswitch
agent service for composable roles.

Change-Id: I46896389e48cdbe2864bf5b609a786f1c84ef908
Closes-Bug: #1673126
(cherry picked from commit 8eaa5f8e10a801be8fc45eeaaa479e7774d97997)

added_lines: --- fixes: - | Updated bigswitch environment file to include the bigswitch agent installation and correct support for the restproxy configuration.

commit_message:
Delete import_exceptions from tox.ini

Current hacking check actually does not check attribute-level
imports. We can safely drop import_exceptions from tox.ini.

Change-Id: I65e36b9661fbcb39bd37d1024a7e0973c3edc416

commit_message:
Remove enabled_services=tempest from patrole gate jobs.

Currently, ENABLED_SERVICES=tempest is contained in the gate jobs
for patrole. This appears to be causing problem when setting
up the multinode devstack environment [0], because

  tempest verify-config

is executed, which fails because:

  AttributeError: 'Manager' object has no attribute 'image_client'

which probably happens because tempest isn't set up on the other nodes,
causing tempest verify-config to fail.

Other multinode setups do not contain ENABLED_SERVICES=tempest:
for example [1]. Regardless, tempest is added to ENABLED_SERVICES
automatically by a script, apparently after devstack is done [1].

[0] http://logs.openstack.org/68/452768/2/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-patrole-multinode-admin-ubuntu-xenial-nv/6401f12/logs/devstack-subnodes-early.txt.gz
[1] http://logs.openstack.org/41/452041/7/check/gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-scenario-multinode-ubuntu-xenial-nv/5907cf4/logs/devstack-subnodes-early.txt.gz

Change-Id: I0d59d6b956ff50e18364775054e16be79c39d799

commit_message:
Add "ssl" option for amqp driver

This uses the underlying x-ssl option that will attempt an SSL
connection to the server using the system's CA bundle.

Change-Id: I73f3b43b4ebc0c4ce4c0ba43b5a84361fb308686
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/63/438563/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.ssl = config.oslo_messaging_amqp.ssl if self.ssl: conn_props["x-ssl"] = self.ssl

subject: Build-depends on openstack-pkg-tools >= 54~
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-04-03 14:56:24.000000000', 'files': ['debian/changelog', 'debian/control'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/deb-designate/commit/b530a2bd76a565c801733c2f7128faef9805cb4e', 'message': "Build-depends on openstack-pkg-tools >= 54~

  * Build-depends on openstack-pkg-tools >= 54~ to ensure the config script
    doesn't use net-tools or iproute2, which are not essential packages.

Change-Id: I80e4c8fc5a94551fadb3ba3d5e13a87c45dbf6aa
"}]
commit_message:
Build-depends on openstack-pkg-tools >= 54~

  * Build-depends on openstack-pkg-tools >= 54~ to ensure the config script
    doesn't use net-tools or iproute2, which are not essential packages.

Change-Id: I80e4c8fc5a94551fadb3ba3d5e13a87c45dbf6aa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/deb-designate refs/changes/81/452781/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Delete symlinks and other non-files when collect logs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-16 19:36:24.000000000', 'files': ['roles/collect-logs/tasks/collect.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/commit/5baa583679fc4e272318f482ec436045e8ba5a18', 'message': 'Delete symlinks and other non-files when collect logs

When collecting logs from containers we leave symlinks in out
logs directory which are failed to copy by zuul and it fails
infras logs collecting completely.

Change-Id: Ida87f233f06d4c52bd48a5902706dd68c2b6f063
'}]
commit_message:
Delete symlinks and other non-files when collect logs

When collecting logs from containers we leave symlinks in out
logs directory which are failed to copy by zuul and it fails
infras logs collecting completely.

commit_message:
Remove ipxe dir before download

This commit adds the removal of the /tmp/ipxe directory before
downloading the upstream sources via git.
This will make this script idempotent, otherwise if the directory is
present git command will fail with the entire quickstart command.

Change-Id: Ic2e690f892300d7b17daa256242e2b59424d68f2

subject: [BugFix]Cinder forgets to update 'deleted_at' when deleting
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-28 11:47:32.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_db_api.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/f9012466db95a4e693291a7b5af21842a85843c2', 'message': "[BugFix]Cinder forgets to update 'deleted_at' when deleting

Usually we would update the 'deleted_at' column when
soft-deleting records, otherwise the 'db purge' command
would fail because it depends on the 'deleted_at' column.

Close-Bug: #1671354

Change-Id: Ib302488d3a007df09a2e7ece40488c00bf732119
"}]
commit_message:
[BugFix]Cinder forgets to update 'deleted_at' when deleting

Usually we would update the 'deleted_at' column when
soft-deleting records, otherwise the 'db purge' command
would fail because it depends on the 'deleted_at' column.

Close-Bug: #1671354

Change-Id: Ib302488d3a007df09a2e7ece40488c00bf732119
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/35/450735/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
global-requirements: Avoid setuptools 34.3.2

This is a follow-on to I3effb27201496c2cc20762a1d9ad525dafbe37ce. 34.3.2
[1] was released on 3/11/2017 and still has the same problem. Bump excludes
up to this new release.

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/releases/tag/v34.3.2

Change-Id: Iac65cad122164bde8a114ed63c14c039ed5d5e3b
(cherry picked from commit 7c2bd3efb948c2e581d810f588d890823b580012)

commit_message:
Delete the failure host from reserved_host

If the failure host is selected as reserved_host,
evacuation to the failure host will be executed.
This patch added processing to change the 'reserved' column
of hosts to False so that the failure host will not be selected
as reserved_host.

Change-Id: I6e5f1087baf64787d759ed7c5b318d4a14aecb4c
Closes-Bug: #1670940

commit_message:
Add "Save and Close" button to configuration modal dialog

Depending on your preferred workflow, you might want the dialog to close once
you've saved your changes.  To support both scenarios, this commit introduces a
new button in the same form which simply reads "Save and Close".  This way, the
user can choose what they'd like to happen once their changes are saved.

Closes-Bug: #1674789
(cherry picked from commit d238f308efc326eedcb26c4ce14e4db375145d43)

Change-Id: I84b1d603d34bde60f0edac7b2ce407f357426b23

added_lines: import { Link, browserHistory } from 'react-router'; }, saveAndClose: { id: 'EnvironmentConfiguration.saveAndClose', defaultMessage: 'Save And Close' closeOnSubmit: false, if (this.state.closeOnSubmit) { this.setState({ closeOnSubmit: false }); browserHistory.push(this.props.parentPath); } } onSubmitAndClose() { this.setState({ closeOnSubmit: true }, this.refs.environmentConfigurationForm.submit); <button type="button" disabled={!this.state.canSubmit} onClick={this.onSubmitAndClose.bind(this)} className="btn btn-default"> <FormattedMessage {...messages.saveAndClose} /> </button>

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of
the _LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to
avoid confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Disable N531 neutron-lib check (still present in current release)

Also fix a missing space in error message

Change-Id: I6fb627d081dc59fcf0a36d80a6e24f866665787c

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 15.1.1

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Change-Id: I5f5b29285bfd0dd6d46dd8b55be3f31f70e21b18
Depends-On: I6c48c4defd807e2ea907b1dd147581daa6741577

Adds a new config for soft-anti-affinity

Introduces a new config parameter to specify the anti-affinity
policy.

Bumps nova version.

Closes-Bug: 1677604

Change-Id: I8c50057bd43873182058097e802bc839d1be0554

The services directory contains mostly old stuff. Add a warning
about it until we decide to remove it once and for all.

commit_message:
Install requirements with pip update

Sometimes during the development you want to install updated
roles when running quickstart, so run pip with -U.

Change-Id: Id787b482014667423963e250a5d98160f0ed6440

subject: Fix token auth in ansible inventory script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-31 11:11:52.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/tripleo-ansible-inventory'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations/commit/b669bcbf45e13961b1fb2bc79a6c656fe45180e5', 'message': 'Fix token auth in ansible inventory script

The token authentication in the inventory script currently uses the
`user_domain_id` parameter, which is supposed to be used with password
authentication only.

This patch removed the param.

Change-Id: I5ec5aa386eb267283cc187cf1d4206827e6b3191
Closes-Bug: #1678029
'}]
commit_message:
Fix token auth in ansible inventory script

The token authentication in the inventory script currently uses the
`user_domain_id` parameter, which is supposed to be used with password
authentication only.

This patch removed the param.

Change-Id: I5ec5aa386eb267283cc187cf1d4206827e6b3191
Closes-Bug: #1678029
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations refs/changes/47/452147/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Docs: add a note about rackspace API keys

Some users are forced to use these instead of passwords (whether because
they use 2-factor auth or by policy). Document it so they know how.

Change-Id: I558c2e8d3e8b0fad0a96a361232f14443e82a35f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-client-config refs/changes/63/451563/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * While passwords are recommended for use, API keys do work as well. The `rackspaceauth` python package must be installed, and then the following can be added to clouds.yaml:: auth: username: myusername api_key: myapikey auth_type: rackspace_apikey

Change-Id: I49d6010f7c976d188c9caee791d3abcdfd9da0cc

commit_message:
Add stack to libvirt group when nova not enabled

This patch ensures that STACK_USER is added to libvirt group when
Nova is not enabled, as Ironic still requires to manage VMs.

Change-Id: I49d6010f7c976d188c9caee791d3abcdfd9da0cc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/16/415016/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if ! is_service_enabled nova; then local libvirt_group if [[ "$os_VENDOR" =~ (Debian) ]]; then libvirt_group=libvirt else libvirt_group=libvirtd fi add_user_to_group $STACK_USER $libvirt_group fi fi

subject: Break user credentials from host at the rightmost '@'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-23 19:43:32.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/transport.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging/commit/d7775859b463ada7273e128c188ec87317e39e89', 'message': "Break user credentials from host at the rightmost '@'

The rightmost '@' in a url netloc field separates the user:password
from the hostname:port.  Using the first may cause the separation to
occur in the username or password field (if unencoded).

Change-Id: I7b02d8e0cbdf875ea80a55065ce98fa73696e05f
Closes-Bug: 1675423
"}]
commit_message:
Break user credentials from host at the rightmost '@'

The rightmost '@' in a url netloc field separates the user:password
from the hostname:port.  Using the first may cause the separation to
occur in the username or password field (if unencoded).

Change-Id: I7b02d8e0cbdf875ea80a55065ce98fa73696e05f
Closes-Bug: 1675423
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/98/449298/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Switch Castellan to Release with Intermediaries

Previously, Castellan was an idependently-released
library, with the most recent release being 0.5.0.
This patch intends to add Castellan as a managed
"Release with Intermediaries" project.

Change-Id: I6f8b164aa8c61cebe09d3f157f905b0157cf7d1a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/63/451963/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- launchpad: castellan release-model: cycle-with-intermediary send-announcements-to: openstack-announce@lists.openstack.org team: barbican type: library

commit_message:
docker-cmd: simplify building config ids for delete

Only the config IDs are needed so only build and pass a list of IDs
instead of parsed configs.

Change-Id: I7dfc1728ddd80b2dbd6652c838c11ab2414ad7b7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-agents refs/changes/29/451129/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cmd_config_ids = [c['id'] for c in configs if c['group'] == 'docker-cmd'] try: delete_missing_configs(cmd_config_ids)def delete_missing_configs(config_ids): return
deleted_lines: import yaml cmd_configs = list(build_configs(configs)) try: delete_missing_configs(cmd_configs)def build_configs(configs): for c in configs: if c['group'] != 'docker-cmd': continue if not isinstance(c['config'], dict): # convert config to dict c['config'] = yaml.safe_load(c['config']) yield c def delete_missing_configs(configs): config_ids = [c['id'] for c in configs] return

Alphabetize packages

Some images have packages sorted alphabetically and some not.
Unify common style between all images.

commit_message:
Switch OVB to use promoted repos from trunk.rdoproject.org

CDN sync is broken:
https://bugs.centos.org/view.php?id=12994

Let's use the repo from rdoproject.org, less reliable but temporary
until CDN works.

We're also working on using mirrors from OpenStack Infra, so this patch
is temporary for a few days, it should be ok.

Change-Id: I3c2f8caeca41a6fa94eb22583868581f8378098a

objects is required. Old RPC services and objects may still be running
while an upgrade is in progress. This makes sure that these old
services are called and all objects are used in a supported RPC and
objects version.

This patch adds the configuration option "pin_release_version". Setting
this option caps (downgrades) the internal RPC communication to the
specified version to enable communication with older services. When
doing a rolling upgrade from version X to Y, set this to X. It defaults
to using the newest (current) possible RPC behavior and object versions.

commit_message:
Add RPC and object version pinning

To support rolling upgrades, capping of RPC communication and Ironic
objects is required. Old RPC services and objects may still be running
while an upgrade is in progress. This makes sure that these old
services are called and all objects are used in a supported RPC and
objects version.

This patch adds the configuration option "pin_release_version". Setting
this option caps (downgrades) the internal RPC communication to the
specified version to enable communication with older services. When
doing a rolling upgrade from version X to Y, set this to X. It defaults
to using the newest (current) possible RPC behavior and object versions.

Change-Id: Ie2342d4051f85392a8b10d39ebffc287da57bf2b
Partial-Bug: #1526283
Co-Authored-By: Szymon Borkowski <szymon.borkowski@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ruby Loo <ruby.loo@intel.com>

commit_message:
Cleanup plugin loaded_base

neutron_plugin_loaded_base is only used in the template. This
var probably shouldn't be used by any deployer, so we mask this
variable from the defaults.

Change-Id: I8d7903dbb9a6f7d096eb3f840164b87c48eb5e4d
(manual cherry picked from commit 6c2b61453320d81f9b459396157aaf68f2d38462)

Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>

commit_message:
Use correct region value

TripleO is using 'regionOne' instead of default 'RegionOne',
so we need to override the default in config file.

Closes-Bug: rhbz#1357579

(cherry picked from commit 5af714c0a8843511a9ea0a9d29febd14b0a39e0d)
Conflicts:
	tripleoclient/utils.py

Change-Id: I7c16bbed9b86ee3331aa9f7fea1a0cf6c80b9ca8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/34/398234/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Create required sections for section in ('compute', 'compute-feature-enabled', 'identity', 'image', 'network', 'object-storage', 'orchestration', 'volume', 'volume-feature-enabled'): config.add_section(section) # Fix region value because TripleO is using non-standard value for section in ('compute', 'identity', 'image', 'network', 'object-storage', 'orchestration', 'volume'): config.set(section, 'region', 'regionOne')

commit_message:
Update devref for update_objects

As a new method to do update fields for
multiple projects will be added by [1].
this patch adds the example for it.

[1]. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/452266
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

Depends-On: I2347fedbecef823babe3d8038f5a74b21fc0a602
Change-Id: I272236b04665d600f1c8824e7165ed3299921cd3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/33/452333/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :code:`delete()`, :code:`delete_objects()` and :code:`update_objects`. The nature of OVO is, when any change is applied, OVO tracks it. After calling :code:`create()` or :code:`update()`, OVO detects this and changed fields are saved in the database. Please take a look at simple object usage scenarios using example of DNSNameServer: # to update fields in multiple objects: filters = {'subnet_id': 'xxx'} values = {'order': 2} DNSNameServer.update_objects(context, values, **filters) :code:`delete_objects()`, :code:`update_objects` and :code:`objects_exist()`, :code:`validate_filters()` is invoked, to see if it's a supported filter criterion (which is by default non-synthetic fields only). Additional filters can be defined using :code:`register_filter_hook_on_model()`. This will add the requested string to valid filter names in object implementation. It is optional.
deleted_lines: :code:`delete()` and :code:`delete_objects()`. The nature of OVO is, when any change is applied, OVO tracks it. After calling :code:`create()` or :code:`update()`, OVO detects this and changed fields are saved in the database. Please take a look at simple object usage scenarios using example of DNSNameServer::code:`delete_objects()` and :code:`objects_exist()`, :code:`validate_filters()` is invoked, to see if it's a supported filter criterion (which is by default non-synthetic fields only). Additional filters can be defined using :code:`register_filter_hook_on_model()`. This will add the requested string to valid filter names in object implementation. It is optional.

commit_message:
Refactor logic of getting exector's executor_thread_pool_size

  'executor_thread_pool_size'
* Move eventlet patched checking to constructor

commit_message:
Separate RHEL from Ubuntu code and fix Ubuntu ceph default repo url.

The ceph repo for Ubunto was broken and pointed to
http://mirror.centos.org/centos/7/storage/x86_64/ceph-jewel/dists/xenial/main/binary-amd64/Packages
[1].

Furthermore epel activation/deactivation makes no sense on Ubuntu
platform.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/65/432165/19/check/gate-puppet-vswitch-puppet-beaker-rspec-ubuntu-xenial/daad266/console.html#_2017-04-03_05_13_45_306095

Closes-Bug: #1678932

Change-Id: I5d3c75b14145d3f55eec5f019b962cc4888404e5

commit_message:
Remove unused methods in unit test test_revoke

This patch removes clutter in the test by removing a few methods
that were not being called and used anymore. Among the removed
methods are _past_time, test_cleanup, and _assertEmpty.

Change-Id: I9f9604786e476d7a1281de8ed2b91770b515d9bb

subject: Role based resource access control - get executions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-27 08:30:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/28f00184acae17385dd6fce43d7511a78de2be91', 'message': 'Role based resource access control - get executions

We already supported role based api access control, this series patches
will implement resource access control for mistral, so that
administrator could define the rules of resource accessibility, e.g.
admin user could get/delete/update the workflows of other tenants
according to the policy.

This patch supports admin user to query executions of other tenants.

Partially implements: blueprint mistral-rbac

Change-Id: I7a5de13d4a067456bb001640189e54a230f196ad
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-27 09:31:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/9b37d0a397d7b4f3764e0464689af9be44578b8b', 'message': 'Role based resource access control - get executions

We already supported role based api access control, this series patches
will implement resource access control for mistral, so that
administrator could define the rules of resource accessibility, e.g.
admin user could get/delete/update the workflows of other tenants
according to the policy.

This patch supports admin user to query executions of other tenants.

commit_message:
Role based resource access control - get executions

We already supported role based api access control, this series patches
will implement resource access control for mistral, so that
administrator could define the rules of resource accessibility, e.g.
admin user could get/delete/update the workflows of other tenants
according to the policy.

This patch supports admin user to query executions of other tenants.

Partially implements: blueprint mistral-rbac

Change-Id: I7a5de13d4a067456bb001640189e54a230f196ad

added_lines: from oslo_utils import uuidutilsfrom mistral.tests.unit import base as unit_base @mock.patch('mistral.db.v2.api.get_workflow_executions') @mock.patch('mistral.context.context_from_headers_and_env') def test_get_all_projects_admin(self, mock_context, mock_get_execs): admin_ctx = unit_base.get_context(admin=True) mock_context.return_value = admin_ctx resp = self.app.get('/v2/executions?all_projects=true') self.assertEqual(200, resp.status_int) self.assertTrue(mock_get_execs.call_args[1].get('insecure', False)) def test_get_all_projects_normal_user(self): resp = self.app.get( '/v2/executions?all_projects=true', expect_errors=True ) self.assertEqual(403, resp.status_int) @mock.patch('mistral.db.v2.api.get_workflow_executions') @mock.patch('mistral.context.context_from_headers_and_env') def test_get_all_filter_by_project_id(self, mock_context, mock_get_execs): admin_ctx = unit_base.get_context(admin=True) mock_context.return_value = admin_ctx fake_project_id = uuidutils.generate_uuid() resp = self.app.get('/v2/executions?project_id=%s' % fake_project_id) self.assertEqual(200, resp.status_int) self.assertTrue(mock_get_execs.call_args[1].get('insecure', False)) self.assertTrue( mock_get_execs.call_args[1].get('project_id', fake_project_id) )

commit_message:
NFS: Failed to create or delete snapshot

In the implementation of the creation or deletion snapshot, the function
will check whether the nfs snapshot function is enabled, but the function
check_snapshot_support there is a default parameter setup_checking, the
default value is False. In the function set_checking if the set_checking
value of setup_checking is False, it will fail to create or delete the
snapshot, even if the nfs configuration supports snapshots.

Change-Id: I7be88b1ea2149b6e0f320f250e707a677c75ec2b
Closes-Bug: #1675326

commit_message:
use the constraints list when installing the constraints list

Some of the dependencies may not be constrained on their own (pbr) so
use the constraints list to enforce the constraints.

Change-Id: I3ae5835d1b1b8f75608d7bb110732f9be233b13f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
doc: Document the available configuration options

They're documented in the source. Let's document them in the actual
documentation.

Change-Id: Ia320808630281009c1700cb1ad25340761af86a0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/reno refs/changes/63/449563/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The following options are configurable: `notesdir` The notes subdirectory within the `relnotesdir` where the notes live. Defaults to ``notes``. `collapse_pre_releases` Should pre-release versions be merged into the final release of the same number (`1.0.0.0a1` notes appear under `1.0.0`). Defaults to ``True``. `stop_at_branch_base` Should the scanner stop at the base of a branch (True) or go ahead and scan the entire history (False)? Defaults to ``True``. `branch` The git branch to scan. Defaults to the "current" branch checked out. `earliest_version` The earliest version to be included. This is usually the lowest version number, and is meant to be the oldest version. If unset, all versions will be scanned. Defaults to ``None``. `template` The template used by reno new to create a note. `release_tag_re` The regex pattern used to match the repo tags representing a valid release version. The pattern is compiled with the verbose and unicode flags enabled. Defaults to ``((?:[\d.ab]|rc)+)``. `pre_release_tag_re` The regex pattern used to check if a valid release version tag is also a valid pre-release version. The pattern is compiled with the verbose and unicode flags enabled. The pattern must define a group called `pre_release` that matches the pre-release part of the tag and any separator, e.g for pre-release version `12.0.0.0rc1` the default RE pattern will identify `.0rc1` as the value of the group 'pre_release'. Defaults to ``(?P<pre_release>\.\d+(?:[ab]|rc)+\d*)$``. `branch_name_re` The pattern for names for branches that are relevant when scanning history to determine where to stop, to find the "base" of a branch. Other branches are ignored. Defaults to ``stable/.+``. `sections` The identifiers and names of permitted sections in the release notes, in the order in which the final report will be generated. A prelude section will always be automatically inserted before the first element of this list.

commit_message:
Move horizon to step 3

We configure apache in step 3 so horizon should be configured at the
same time or else updates will cause horizon to be unvailable during the
update process.

Change-Id: I4032f7c24edc0ff9ed637e213870cdd3beb9a54e
Closes-Bug: #1678338

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # require 'spec_helper' describe 'tripleo::profile::base::horizon' do shared_examples_for 'tripleo::profile::base::horizon' do let(:pre_condition) do "class { '::tripleo::profile::base::aodh': step => #{params[:step]}, oslomsg_rpc_hosts => ['localhost.localdomain'] }" end context 'with step less than 3' do let(:params) { { :step => 2 } } it 'should do nothing' do is_expected.to contain_class('tripleo::profile::base::horizon') is_expected.to_not contain_class('horizon') end end context 'with step 3' do let(:params) { { :step => 3, } } it 'should trigger complete configuration' do is_expected.to contain_class('horizon') is_expected.to contain_class('apache::mod::remoteip') is_expected.to contain_class('apache::mod::status') end end end on_supported_os.each do |os, facts| context "on #{os}" do let(:facts) do facts.merge({ :hostname => 'node.example.com' }) end it_behaves_like 'tripleo::profile::base::horizon' end end end

commit_message:
Qpid dispatch router composable role

Note: since it replaces rabbitmq, in order to aim for the smallest
amount of changes the service_name is called 'rabbitmq' so all the
other services do not need additional logic to use qdr.

Depends-On: Idecbbabdd4f06a37ff0cfb34dc23732b1176a608
Change-Id: I27f01d2570fa32de91ffe1991dc873cdf2293dbc

commit_message:
Remove useless trailing '\n' in /etc/hosts file.

In HA deployment mode, we've got some trailing '\n' generated at the beginning
of each controller role nodes line in the undercloud /etc/hosts [1].

[1] - http://paste.openstack.org/show/603721/

Closes-Bug: #1674697

Change-Id: Ic38bc2a5df79dadf72025f207e91a38cc0ab0a92
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Increase libvirt/qemu.conf max_files and max_processes

When Nova and/or Cinder are using Ceph as backend, qemu will need to
open a connection and two threads for each and every Ceph OSD.

This change raises the max_files (set to 1024 by default) to 32768 and
the max_processes (set to 4096 by default) to 131072. The max number
of FDs is per-process, while the max number of processes is
per-user. The values can be overridden via ExtraConfig, no params are
added to the templates.

A more detailed description of the values were chosen can be found at:
https://access.redhat.com/solutions/1602683

Unclean cherry-pick from I1e79675f6aac1b0fe6cc7269550fa6bc8586e1fb

Change-Id: I1e79675f6aac1b0fe6cc7269550fa6bc8586e1fb
Depends-On: I258afd3ee6633e4b2ebc45aa8611be652476be0c
Closes-Bug: 1673995

This patch adds support to deploy Ironic with separate Neutron network
for provisioning baremetal instances.

  * Add NetworkDeploymentSerialazer100 as Ironic multitenancy is supported
    from Newton, and we will backport this till stable/newton.
  * Update network scheme generation to create 'vlan' baremetal network,
    assign IPs to Ironic conductors from this network, make them
    accessible from baremetal servers.
  * Add new checkbox at 'Openstack Settings/Additional components' tab
    which allows to define if separate provisioning network should be used
    during deployment. This is a trigger to switch ironic deployment to
    multitenancy case. If not checked old behaviour is keept, 'flat'
    network is used. The checkbox is shown only when Ironic component is
    enabled.

Change-Id: I861a8b3b046202526d6a856c9f2dca2cfaddc887
Related-Bug: #1588380
"}, {'number': 9, 'created': '2017-03-17 10:07:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web/commit/3a3e62f19f202ccc079ba75285949c2d37947e21', 'message': "Add Ironic multitenancy support

commit_message:
Add Ironic multitenancy support

This patch adds support to deploy Ironic with separate Neutron network
for provisioning baremetal instances.

  * Add NetworkDeploymentSerializer100 as Ironic multitenancy is supported
    from Newton, and we will backport this till stable/newton.
  * Update network scheme generation to create 'vlan' baremetal network,
    assign IPs to Ironic conductors from this network, make them
    accessible from baremetal servers.
  * Add new checkbox at 'Openstack Settings/Additional components' tab
    which allows to define if separate provisioning network should be used
    during deployment. This is a trigger to switch ironic deployment to
    multitenancy case. If not selected old behaviour is kept, 'flat'
    network is used. The checkbox is shown only when Ironic component is
    enabled.

Change-Id: I861a8b3b046202526d6a856c9f2dca2cfaddc887
Related-Bug: #1588380

commit_message:
Bootstrap Queens goals directory

Create directory structure for Queens goals so that we
can start proposing goals to it. Add placeholder document
so that Sphinx wouldn't complain about an empty directory.

Change-Id: I67665bc65ac2c4b6647bfe221f43141c819378cf

subject: Fix potential cluster setup race
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-30 13:56:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-pacemaker/commit/e45460a7e6a488e22c904050308039348401f153', 'message': 'WIP Fix potential cluster setup race

It seems currently there is a small window for a race opportunity
when we set up the pacemaker cluster with puppet-pacemaker.
The operator will observe the following error:

Error: /Stage[main]/Pacemaker::Corosync/Exec[Start Cluster
tripleo_cluster]/returns: change from notrun to 0 failed:
/sbin/pcs cluster start --all returned 1 instead of one of 0

The following might happen:
On the bootstrap node (where setup_cluster is true) we call
Exec <|tag == 'pacemaker-auth'|> ->
exec {"Create Cluster ${cluster_name}":
  creates => '/etc/cluster/cluster.conf',
  command => "${::pacemaker::pcs_bin} cluster setup --name ${cluster_name} ${cluster_members_rrp_real} ${cluster_setup_extras_real}",
  unless => '/usr/bin/test -f /etc/corosync/corosync.conf',
  require => Class['::pacemaker::install'],
} -> exec {"Start Cluster ${cluster_name}":
  unless => "${::pacemaker::pcs_bin} status >/dev/null 2>&1",
  command => "${::pacemaker::pcs_bin} cluster start --all",
  require => Exec["Create Cluster ${cluster_name}"],
}

The problem with the above is that "pcs cluster setup"
internally will call pcsd.pcsd_sync_certs(...) which will restart pcsd
without waiting. So if we restart pcsd on all nodes and then
jump straift to "pcs cluster start --all" the pcs API call that
starts the cluster on the remote node might happen during the pcsd
restart and hence get a 400 BAD request:
I, [2017-03-29T07:25:00.943344 #15581] INFO -- : CIB USER: hacluster, groups:
Shutting down (TERM)Shutting down (TERM)
[2017-03-29 07:25:09] INFO going to shutdown ...
I, [2017-03-29T07:25:09.901537 #15581] INFO -- : Return Value:
::ffff:172.17.0.17 - - [29/Mar/2017:07:25:09 +0000] "GET /remote/cluster_start HTTP/1.1" 400 - 8.9617
[2017-03-29 07:25:09] INFO WEBrick::HTTPServer#start done.

We try to address this by doing two things:
A) We add a --wait switch to the cluster setup which should wait until
   the restart is complete.
B) We add a set of retries to the cluster start statement

While it is likely that either one of these be enough to close this
race, given the elusiveness of the problem (in CI upstream we hit
it twice in the last month), I prefer taking a more comprehensive
approach at closing this window.

Another option would have been to remove the cluster start exec
statement and simply add --start to the cluster setup call. This
approach seems to me like a smaller less invasive change. Since I'd like
to backport this issue to older releases as well, I prefer to not
change the setup code too much at this stage.

Change-Id: I7cdfcbced0031040e9f45ddba7389868bb3f59b2
Closes-Bug: #1677312

commit_message:
Fix potential cluster setup race

It seems currently there is a small window for a race opportunity
when we set up the pacemaker cluster with puppet-pacemaker.
The operator will observe the following error:

Error: /Stage[main]/Pacemaker::Corosync/Exec[Start Cluster
tripleo_cluster]/returns: change from notrun to 0 failed:
/sbin/pcs cluster start --all returned 1 instead of one of 0

The following might happen:
On the bootstrap node (where setup_cluster is true) we call
Exec <|tag == 'pacemaker-auth'|> ->
exec {"Create Cluster ${cluster_name}":
  creates => '/etc/cluster/cluster.conf',
  command => "${::pacemaker::pcs_bin} cluster setup --name ${cluster_name} ${cluster_members_rrp_real} ${cluster_setup_extras_real}",
  unless => '/usr/bin/test -f /etc/corosync/corosync.conf',
  require => Class['::pacemaker::install'],
} -> exec {"Start Cluster ${cluster_name}":
  unless => "${::pacemaker::pcs_bin} status >/dev/null 2>&1",
  command => "${::pacemaker::pcs_bin} cluster start --all",
  require => Exec["Create Cluster ${cluster_name}"],
}

The problem with the above is that "pcs cluster setup"
internally will call pcsd.pcsd_sync_certs(...) which will restart pcsd
without waiting. So if we restart pcsd on all nodes and then
jump straift to "pcs cluster start --all" the pcs API call that
starts the cluster on the remote node might happen during the pcsd
restart and hence get a 400 BAD request:
I, [2017-03-29T07:25:00.943344 #15581] INFO -- : CIB USER: hacluster, groups:
Shutting down (TERM)Shutting down (TERM)
[2017-03-29 07:25:09] INFO going to shutdown ...
I, [2017-03-29T07:25:09.901537 #15581] INFO -- : Return Value:
::ffff:172.17.0.17 - - [29/Mar/2017:07:25:09 +0000] "GET /remote/cluster_start HTTP/1.1" 400 - 8.9617
[2017-03-29 07:25:09] INFO WEBrick::HTTPServer#start done.

We try to address this by doing two things:
A) We add a --wait switch to the cluster setup which should wait until
   the restart is complete.
B) We add a set of retries to the cluster start statement

While it is likely that either one of these be enough to close this
race, given the elusiveness of the problem (in CI upstream we hit
it twice in the last month), I prefer taking a more comprehensive
approach at closing this window.

Another option would have been to remove the cluster start exec
statement and simply add --start to the cluster setup call. This
approach seems to me like a smaller less invasive change. Since I'd like
to backport this issue to older releases as well, I prefer to not
change the setup code too much at this stage.

Change-Id: I7cdfcbced0031040e9f45ddba7389868bb3f59b2
Closes-Bug: #1677312

appending /ec2tokens

commit_message:
Set REMAINING_TIME for local run

When running CI scripts locally it fails because REMAINING_TIME is
propagated by infra before the job starts. This patch sets it to
some default value if it wasn't set before.

Change-Id: I0050046db17e50ddd17a7115e46c4684afa87b2f

\uc815\uc758\ud569\ub2c8\ub2e4.", "DeploymentPlan.configureRolesStepTooltip": "\uc774 \uacfc\uc815\uc740 \uc624\ubc84\ud074\ub77c\uc6b0\ub4dc \ub0b4 \uc5ed\ud560\uc5d0\uc11c \ub178\ub4dc\ub97c \ud560\ub2f9 \ubc0f \uc81c\uac70\ud569\ub2c8\ub2e4. \uac1c\ubcc4 \uc5ed\ud560 \uc120\ud0dd \ub2e4\uc774\uc5bc\ub85c\uadf8 \ucc3d\uc5d0\uc11c, \uc0ac\uc6a9 \uac00\ub2a5\ud55c \ub178\ub4dc\ub97c \uc5ed\ud560\uc5d0 \ud0dc\uae45\ud558\uac70\ub098 \uc5ed\ud560\uc5d0 \uc774\ubbf8 \ud560\ub2f9\ub41c \ub178\ub4dc\uc5d0 \ud0dc\uae45\uc744 \uc81c\uac70\ud560 \uc218 \uc788\uc2b5\ub2c8\ub2e4. \ud2b9\uc815 \uc5ed\ud560\uc5d0\uc11c \"\ub178\ub4dc \ud560\ub2f9\" \uc744 \ud074\ub9ad\ud558\uc5ec \uc120\ud0dd \ub2e4\uc774\uc5bc\ub85c\uadf8 \ucc3d\uc744 \uc5f0 \ud6c4, \ub178\ub4dc\ub97c \ud560\ub2f9 \uc2dc\uc791\ud569\ub2c8\ub2e4. \ub610\ud55c \ud574\ub2f9 \uacfc\uc815\uc5d0\uc11c \uc5ed\ud560\uc5d0 \ub300\ud574 \uad6c\uccb4\uc801\uc778 \uc124\uc815\uc744 \ucee4\uc2a4\ud130\ub9c8\uc774\uc9d5 \uac00\ub2a5\ud569\ub2c8\ub2e4. \uc608\ub97c \ub4e4\uc5b4, \uc11c\ube44\uc2a4\ub97c \uac1c\ubcc4 \ub178\ub4dc\uc5d0 \uad6c\uc131\ud558\uace0 \uac01 \uc5ed\ud560\uacfc \uad00\ub828\ub41c \ud2b9\uc815 \ub9e4\uac1c\ubcc0\uc218\ub97c \ucee4\uc2a4\ud130\ub9c8\uc774\uc9d5\ud560 \uc218 \uc788\uc2b5\ub2c8\ub2e4. \uac1c\ubcc4 \uc5ed\ud560 \uc624\ub978\ucabd \uc0c1\ub2e8\uc5d0 \uc788\ub294 \uc5f0\ud544 \uc544\uc774\ud3f0\uc744 \ud074\ub9ad\ud558\uc5ec \uc5ed\ud560\uc5d0 \ub300\ud574 \uad6c\uccb4\uc801\uc778 \uc124\uc815\uc744 \uc0b4\ud3b4\ubd05\ub2c8\ub2e4.", "DeploymentPlan.deploymentStepTooltip": "\uc774 \uacfc\uc815\uc740 \uc624\ubc84\ud074\ub77c\uc6b0\ub4dc \ubc30\ud3ec\ub97c \uc218\ud589\ud569\ub2c8\ub2e4. \ubc30\ud3ec\uac00 \uc2dc\uc791\ub418\uba74 director\ub294 \uacfc\uc815\uc744 \ucd94\uc801\ud558\uace0 \uac01 \uc644\ub8cc, \uc2e4\ud589, \ub610\ub294 \uc2e4\ud328\ud55c \ub2e8\uacc4\uc5d0 \ub300\ud55c \ubcf4\uace0\uc11c\ub97c \uc81c\uacf5\ud569\ub2c8\ub2e4. \ubc30\ud3ec\uac00 \uc644\ub8cc\ub418\uc5c8\uc744 \ub54c, director\ub294 \ub300\uc0c1 \uc624\ubc84\ud074\ub77c\uc6b0\ub4dc\uc640 \uc0c1\ud638\uc791\uc6a9\ud558\ub294\ub370 \uc0ac\uc6a9\ud558\ub294 \ud604\uc7ac \uc624\ubc84\ud074\ub77c\uc6b0\ub4dc \uc0c1\ud0dc \ubc0f \ub85c\uadf8\uc778 \uc815\ubcf4\ub97c \ud45c\uc2dc\ud569\ub2c8\ub2e4. \"\ubc30\ud3ec\" \ubc84\ud2bc\uc744 \ud074\ub9ad\ud558\uc5ec \ubc30\ud3ec\ub97c \uc2dc\uc791\ud569\ub2c8\ub2e4.", "DeploymentPlan.hardwareStepTooltip": "\uc774 \uacfc\uc815\uc740 \ub178\ub4dc\ub97c \ub4f1\ub85d\ud558\uace0 \uc0b4\ud3b4\ubd05\ub2c8\ub2e4. \ub4f1\ub85d \uacfc\uc815\uc740 director\uac00 introspection \ubc0f \ud504\ub85c\ube44\uc800\ub2dd commit_message:
Fixes issues with raising mysql file limit

Changes Include:
 - Adds spec testing
 - Only raise limits if nonha.  puppet-systemd will restart the mariadb
   service which breaks ha deployments.  Hence we only want to do this
   in noha.
 - Minor fix to hiera value refrenced not as parameter to mysql.pp

Partial-Bug: #1648181
Related-Bug: #1524809

Co-Authored By: Feng Pan <fpan@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Id063bf4b4ac229181b01f40965811cb8ac4230d5
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Feng Pan <fpan@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit c9acf8a687ea64686c1ecceeff45add014752121)

subject: Check rabbitmq user at step >= 2
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-30 10:12:55.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/profile/releasenotes/notes/rabbitmq-user-check-95da891a2e197d89.yaml', 'manifests/profile/base/rabbitmq.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/b6a9d14489608e4c3ff48d602351a7b93092b11b', 'message': 'Check rabbitmq user at step >= 2

The rabbitmq user check is moved to step >= 2 from step >= 1. There is
no gaurantee that rabbitmq is running at step 1, especially if updating
a failed stack that never made it past step 1 to begin with.

Change-Id: I029193da4c180deff3ab516bc8dc2da14c279317
Closes-Bug: #1675194
(cherry picked from commit aa9af086f05e466e88ac2a85ecc9d39f5a6d1e2f)
'}]
commit_message:
Check rabbitmq user at step >= 2

The rabbitmq user check is moved to step >= 2 from step >= 1. There is
no gaurantee that rabbitmq is running at step 1, especially if updating
a failed stack that never made it past step 1 to begin with.

Change-Id: I029193da4c180deff3ab516bc8dc2da14c279317
Closes-Bug: #1675194
(cherry picked from commit aa9af086f05e466e88ac2a85ecc9d39f5a6d1e2f)

commit_message:
Fix check-uuid not working

'check-uuid' and 'check-uuid --fix' are not working because we do not
set package name for them. This patch fixes that.

Change-Id: I553c364e3fc0d640620a01046dd7f70bdb704be2
Closes-Bug: #1678407
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/10/452410/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
For healthchecking the rpc server(s) add a simple healthcheck response

This is quite useful for being able to ping a rpc server to
ensure that it is functional, and then expect a response (in this
case 'alive') to know that the server is working.

Change-Id: Iaf8775252d831d2cabbf162a7306b674770a88b8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/53/447153/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _do_health(self, ctx): result = "pong" return self.serializer.serialize_entity(ctxt, result) # This is a special message that only works when # targeted at no namespace... if method == "healthcheck" and not namespace: self._do_health(ctx) return

commit_message:
[zmq]send rpc.call message failed on direct connections dynamic mode

The establishment of the connection is asynchronous in zeromq.
When completed execution acquire_connection() method in class
DealerPublisherDirect, the connection has not been established,
sending a message at this time will fail.So we need a delay 20ms
to wait for the connection establish.

Change-Id: I87eea31b6f0ef48d88873e9a3a2943964bcb52eb
Closes-Bug: #1658913

subject: [zmq] publisher's socket.send() blocked when restart consumer
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-10 06:13:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging/commit/5232bdfcbd5eb126cc84497a2fc048624fd00f45', 'message': "[zmq]publisher's socket.send() blocked when restart consumer

Fault reason:
After restart consumer,the consumer address in database is invalid,
On direct connections dynamic mode,the publisher update addresses
per 180 seconds.Before the addresses have been updated,the publisher
socket is connected to consumer's invalid address.
When send CALL message,publisher socket's option IMMEDIATE=1.
Messages whill be queued only to completed connections.
This will cause the publisher socket to block.
Solution:
When send messages, the publisher should update the consumer
addresses immediately.

Change-Id: Iedb2a3d5375df41c4a82a198a62bf4e7d5fdaf3c
Closes-Bug: #1663459
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-10 12:31:47.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/zmq_driver/client/zmq_routing_table.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging/commit/ff4a35daa1b0de5571fc9973d1b3ea87fc5f1df3', 'message': "[zmq] publisher's socket.send() blocked when restart consumer

commit_message:
[zmq] publisher's socket.send() blocked when restart consumer

Fault reason:
After restart consumer,the consumer address in database is invalid,
On direct connections dynamic mode,the publisher update addresses
per 180 seconds.Before the addresses have been updated,the publisher
socket is connected to consumer's invalid address.
When send CALL message,publisher socket's option IMMEDIATE=1.
Messages whill be queued only to completed connections.
This will cause the publisher socket to block.
Solution:
When send messages, the publisher should update the consumer
addresses immediately.

Change-Id: Iedb2a3d5375df41c4a82a198a62bf4e7d5fdaf3c
Closes-Bug: #1663459

subject: Fix cluster group migration status checks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-03 17:35:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-win/commit/dfdd435f05480638c7a27a4365cd2289ac11ae38', 'message': "Fix cluster group migration polling

We incorrectly assumed that the group state will immediately become
'Pending' when a migration is requested, judging by the expected
'ErrorPending' return code of the move function.

This is not the case, as the group can be reported as 'Online' while
being on the source node, before a live migration is actually
performed successfully. This is incorrectly treated as an exception
at the moment.

For the moment, we'll just wait for the instance to become active
on the destination host, enforcing a timeout. We're adding a 60
seconds default timeout (which should be enough in most cases). This
timeout should become configurable in Nova.

We're planning to implement a custom cluster resource dll, having a
finer control over this.

Closes-Bug: #1628938

Change-Id: I6c268355213718d4d66e0e77a89c558cde3213b6
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-08 19:37:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-win/commit/5d86d2735a61b8d66b9da75cf7c20d581c3dd32a', 'message': "[wip - needs UT] Fix cluster group migration polling

We incorrectly assumed that the group state will immediately become
'Pending' when a migration is requested, judging by the expected
'ErrorPending' return code of the move function.

This is not the case, as the group can be reported as 'Online' while
being on the source node, before a live migration is actually
performed successfully. This is incorrectly treated as an exception
at the moment.

This change refactors the way in which we check pending migrations.
We're now waiting for cluster group change events, having 60 seconds
as a default migration timeout (which should be enough in most cases).

If a migration is attempted but fails, in most cases we'll get the
'Pending' state transition, quickly erroring out when the group state
changes without reaching the desired node/state.

In case of migration timeouts, we're now attempting to cancel pending
migrations.

In the future, we're planning to implement a custom cluster resource
dll, having a finer control over this.

Closes-Bug: #1628938

Change-Id: I6c268355213718d4d66e0e77a89c558cde3213b6
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-15 15:45:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-win/commit/a9775a2c3da074884d2a01c45b2db00717c0da62', 'message': "[wip - needs UT] Fix cluster group migration polling

We incorrectly assumed that the group state will immediately become
'Pending' when a migration is requested, judging by the expected
'ErrorPending' return code of the move function.

This is not the case, as the group can be reported as 'Online' while
being on the source node, before a live migration is actually
performed successfully. This is incorrectly treated as an exception
at the moment.

This change refactors the way in which we check pending migrations.
We rely on cluster group state change events in this matter.

In case of migration timeouts, we're now attempting to cancel pending
migrations.

In the future, we're planning to implement a custom cluster resource
dll, having a finer control over this.

Closes-Bug: #1628938

Change-Id: I6c268355213718d4d66e0e77a89c558cde3213b6

"}, {'number': 12, 'created': '2017-04-03 12:32:49.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/utils/compute/clusterutils.py', 'os_win/tests/unit/test_base.py', 'os_win/tests/unit/utils/compute/test_clusapi_utils.py', 'os_win/exceptions.py', 'os_win/tests/unit/utils/compute/test_clusterutils.py', 'os_win/utils/compute/_clusapi_utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-win/commit/e09f672e228379dbeeebad4156891ddb75a06769', 'message': "Fix cluster group migration status checks

We incorrectly assumed that the group state will immediately become
'Pending' when a migration is requested, judging by the expected
'ErrorPending' return code of the move function.

This is not the case, as the group can be reported as 'Online' while
being on the source node, before a live migration is actually
performed successfully. This is incorrectly treated as an exception
at the moment.

This change refactors the way in which we check pending migrations.
We rely on cluster group state change events in this matter.

In case of migration timeouts, we're now attempting to cancel pending
migrations.

Also, some of the private methods functionality is now publicly
exposed (e.g. canceling migrations, detecting queued migrations).

In the future, we're planning to implement a custom cluster resource
dll, having a finer control over this.

Closes-Bug: #1628938

Change-Id: I6c268355213718d4d66e0e77a89c558cde3213b6
"}]
commit_message:
Fix cluster group migration status checks

We incorrectly assumed that the group state will immediately become
'Pending' when a migration is requested, judging by the expected
'ErrorPending' return code of the move function.

This is not the case, as the group can be reported as 'Online' while
being on the source node, before a live migration is actually
performed successfully. This is incorrectly treated as an exception
at the moment.

This change refactors the way in which we check pending migrations.
We rely on cluster group state change events in this matter.

In case of migration timeouts, we're now attempting to cancel pending
migrations.

Also, some of the private methods functionality is now publicly
exposed (e.g. canceling migrations, detecting queued migrations).

In the future, we're planning to implement a custom cluster resource
dll, having a finer control over this.

Closes-Bug: #1628938

Change-Id: I6c268355213718d4d66e0e77a89c558cde3213b6

commit_message:
POC: provide callbacks for authenticating the message body

Change-Id: Ifdf8bcfec3a0faaa68f40acb4b9935ee1ab4f83f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/19/442119/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (C) 2017 Openstack Foundation. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """Provides an interface for a callback-based message authentication handler. If the application needs the ability to sign and verify the contents of messages exchanged between clients and servers it must derive custom authentication handlers from these base classes. Oslo.Messaging does *not* provide any services for key management - this must be provided by the application. These interfaces merely provide the necessary hooks and context for signing and verifying the message data. ------------------ RPC Authentication ------------------ The application must pass its implementation of an RPCServerAuthenticator to the :py:meth:`get_rpc_server` method. All RPC Clients using the server must be provided a corresponding RPCClientAuthenticator on RPCClient creation. The sign/authenticate flow: 1) The client signs an encoded representation of the request message body and the context (if necessary) using the server's public key. A message containing the signed body and context is sent to the server. 2) The server receives the message and checks the signature of the message body and (optionally) the context. If either the context or the body cannot be verified the respective handler must raise an exception. In this case the request message is discarded. 3) If the context and body are valid the server executes the call/cast. In the case of a call the server then signs the reply with the proper client's keys before sending it back. *Note:* it is left to the application to determine how to find the proper keys for the requesting client. 4) On receipt of the reply the client checks the signature of the reply. If the reply cannot be verified the `verify_reply` handler must raise an exception to cause oslo.messaging to discard the reply. Otherwise the reply is processed normally. --------------------------- Notification Authentication --------------------------- *TBD* ----- """ __all__ = [ 'InvalidContext', 'InvalidRPCRequest', 'InvalidRPCReply', 'ReplySignError', 'RPCClientAuthenticator', 'RPCServerAuthenticator' ] import abc from oslo_messaging import exceptions import six class InvalidContext(exceptions.MessagingException): """Exception to be thrown if authentication of the context fails.""" class InvalidRPCRequest(exceptions.MessagingException): """Exception to be thrown if authentication of an RPC Call or Cast message fails. """ class InvalidRPCReply(exceptions.MessagingException): """Exception to be thrown if authentication of an RPC Reply message fails. """ class ReplySignError(exceptions.MessagingException): """Exception to be thrown if the RPC server cannot sign the reply""" class InvalidNotification(exceptions.MessagingException): """Exception to be thrown if authentication of a Notification message fails. """ @six.add_metaclass(abc.ABCMeta) class RPCClientAuthenticator(object): @abc.abstractmethod def sign_request(self, ctxt, message): """Sign the body of an RPC Call or Cast message This method should create a digest for message and return a serialized form of the data that can be verified by the RPC Server. *Caution* The message argument must be treated as a constant bytes type. Do *NOT* modify it - you may wrap, compress, and/or serialized it but the original value must be available at the server after it has been authenticated. *Caution* Do *NOT* make any assumptions about the content of message - the content is *NOT* considered part of the API and will change without warning, even between fix releases. *Caution* this method is invoked by the internals of the messaging library. The library is not re-entrant: do *NOT* call any oslo.messaging API from within this callout. Undefined behavior will result. :param ctxt: the context supplied to the RPC call/cast (in its original form) :param message: a serialized form of the request's message body :returns: a bytes type containing the signed message body """ @abc.abstractmethod def sign_context(self, ctxt): """Sign an outgoing message's context. Similar to the :py:meth:`sign_request` method except a serialized form of the context is to be signed. This method is called after the request has been signed. See the documentation for :py:meth:`sign_request` method. Note the same Caution statements apply to this method as well :param ctxt: the context as returned by the optional serializer :returns: a bytes type containing the signed context """ @abc.abstractmethod def verify_reply(self, ctxt, reply): """Verify the body of an RPC Reply message This method should check the reply for the proper digest as generated by the :py:meth:`RPCServerAuthenticator.sign_reply` method run on the server. If reply is properly authenticated, then this method must return the original reply passed to the sign_reply() method by the server (e.g. unwrap/decompress/deserialize, etc). If the reply cannot be verified this method must raise an InvalidRPCReply exception. This will cause the RPC Reply to be silently discarded. *Caution*: this method is invoked by the internals of the messaging library. The library is not re-entrant: do *NOT* call any oslo.messaging API from within this callout. Undefined behavior will result. :param ctxt: the context supplied to the RPC call (in its original form) :param reply: signed reply (output of server's sign_reply()) :returns: original reply (as passed to servers's sign_reply()) :raises: :py:exc:`InvalidRPCReply` if the reply cannot be verified. """ @six.add_metaclass(abc.ABCMeta) class RPCServerAuthenticator(object): """An Authenticator base class for RPC Servers""" def __init__(self, enforce=True): """Constructor :param enforce: if false the authenticator will allow messages that do not contain a signature to pass through. This allows backward compatiblity with clients that do not yet support authentication. """ super(RPCServerAuthenticator, self).__init__() self._enforce = enforce @abc.abstractmethod def verify_context(self, ctxt): """Authenticate an incoming message context. This method should check ctxt for the proper digest as generated by the :py:meth:`RPCClientAuthenticator.sign_context` method run on the client. If ctxt is properly authenticated, then this method must return the original context passed to the sign_context() method by the client (e.g. unwrap/decompress/deserialize, etc). If the context cannot be verified this method must raise an InvalidContext exception. This will cause the associated RPC request to be silently discarded. *Caution*: this method is invoked by the internals of the messaging library. The library is not re-entrant: do *NOT* call any oslo.messaging API from within this callout. Undefined behavior will result. :param ctxt: signed context (output of client's sign_context()) :returns: original context (as passed to client's sign_context()) :raises: :py:exc:`InvalidContext` if the context cannot be verified. """ @abc.abstractmethod def verify_request(self, ctxt, message): """Verify the body of an RPC Call or Cast message Similar to the :py:meth:`verify_context` method except a signed form of the RPC Call/Cast message body is provided (as returned by the client's call to :py:meth:`RPCClientAuthenticator.sign_request`. See the documentation for :py:meth:`RPCClientAuthenticator.sign_request` method. Note the same Caution statements apply to this method as well :param ctxt: the context as provided by the client :param message: signed message body (output of client's sign_request()) :returns: original context (as passed to client's sign_request()) :raises: :py:exc:`InvalidRPCRequest` if the request cannot be verified. """ @abc.abstractmethod def sign_reply(self, ctxt, reply): """Sign the body of an RPC Reply message This method should create a digest using reply and return a serialized form of the data that can be verified by the RPC Client - see :py:meth:`RPCClientAuthenticator.verify_reply`. *Caution* The reply argument must be treated as a constant bytes type. Do *NOT* modify - you may wrap, compress, and/or serialized it but the original value must be available at the receiver after it has been authenticated. *Caution* Do *NOT* make any assumptions about the content of reply - the content is *NOT* considered part of the API and will change without warning, even between fix releases. *Caution* this method is invoked by the internals of the messaging library. The library is not re-entrant: do *NOT* call any oslo.messaging API from within this callout. Undefined behavior will result. :param ctxt: the context as set by the client :param reply: the reply message as a bytes type :returns: a bytes type containing the signed reply message :raises: :py:exc:`ReplySignError` if the reply cannot be signed. """

added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import argparse import logging from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_messaging._drivers import impl_zmq from oslo_messaging._drivers.zmq_driver.proxy import zmq_gateway_proxy CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.register_opts(impl_zmq.zmq_opts) opt_group = cfg.OptGroup(name='zmq_gateway_opts', title='ZeroMQ gateway proxy options') CONF.register_opts(zmq_gateway_proxy.opts, group=opt_group) USAGE = """ Usage: ./zmq-gateway.py [-h] [] ... Usage example: python oslo_messaging/_cmd/zmq-gateway.py""" def main(): parser = argparse.ArgumentParser( description='ZeroMQ proxy service', usage=USAGE ) parser.add_argument('--config-file', dest='config_file', type=str, help='Path to configuration file') parser.add_argument('--host', dest='host', type=str, help='Host FQDN for current proxy') parser.add_argument('--frontend-port', dest='frontend_port', type=int, help='Front-end ROUTER port number') parser.add_argument('--backend-port', dest='backend_port', type=int, help='Back-end ROUTER port number') parser.add_argument('--publisher-port', dest='publisher_port', type=int, help='Back-end PUBLISHER port number') parser.add_argument('-d', '--debug', dest='debug', type=bool, default=False, help="Turn on DEBUG logging level instead of INFO") args = parser.parse_args() if args.config_file: cfg.CONF(["--config-file", args.config_file]) log_level = logging.INFO if args.debug: log_level = logging.DEBUG logging.basicConfig(level=log_level, format='%(asctime)s %(name)s ' '%(levelname)-8s %(message)s') if args.host: CONF.zmq_proxy_opts.host = args.host if args.frontend_port: CONF.set_override('frontend_port', args.frontend_port, group='zmq_proxy_opts') if args.backend_port: CONF.set_override('backend_port', args.backend_port, group='zmq_proxy_opts') if args.publisher_port: CONF.set_override('publisher_port', args.publisher_port, group='zmq_proxy_opts') reactor = zmq_proxy.ZmqProxy(CONF, zmq_queue_proxy.UniversalQueueProxy) try: while True: reactor.run() except (KeyboardInterrupt, SystemExit): reactor.close() if __name__ == "__main__": main()

subject: WIP: Backing-off RPC Client/Context
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-06 21:51:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging/commit/40a48dcf3fe79cdb69826c08db0b7e90477d4270', 'message': "WIP: Backing-off RPC Client

DO NOT MERGE: This is a work in progress pending:
- More testing; including verification that it can replace the
 work in[1].
 - Unit tests.
 - Dev-ref.

A while back we had a discussion on ML [2] regarding rehoming
some work done in neutron to implement a 'backing off RPC
Client' [1]. This patch implements the backing off approach from
[1] as a new RPC client that can be used as a drop-in
replacement for RPCClient.

Client's high level functionality:
- Maintains a global mapping of namespaced RPC method names
and their timeout value allowing timeouts to grow per method
globally on MessagingTimeout exceptions.
- By default exponentially grows timeouts capped by a ceiling and
sleeps on each MessagingTimeout for a random time.
- Provides hooks for callers to use their own timeout and wait time
functions when exponential/random doesn't cut it.
- Doesn't rely on a configuration value to set the default timeout,
but rather provides a getter/setter for consumers.
- Only applies to call() when a timeout is not explicity passed in the
call kwarg.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/280595/
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-April/092914.html

Change-Id: I675046e10a2b0cff20d9058752a84d975cd2588f

[1] as a new RPC client that can be used as a drop-in
replacement for RPCClient.

Client's high level functionality:
- Allows consumers to control the scope and initial timeouts
by passing in a defaultdict that's used to track current timeout
values per method. By default the per method timeouts are scoped
to the client instance itself.
- By default, exponentially grows timeouts capped by a ceiling and
sleeps on each MessagingTimeout for a random time.
- Provides hooks for callers to use their own timeout and wait time
functions when exponential/random doesn't cut it.
- Only applies to call() when a timeout is not explicitly passed in the
call kwarg.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/280595/

work. It's provided here as a WIP until oslo cores can agree on

added and additional testing done.

Background:
A while back we had a discussion on ML [1] regarding rehoming
some work done in neutron to implement a 'backing off RPC
Client' [2]. This patch implements that topic.

Implementation:
- Minor refactoring to base call context to support a more object
oriented approach suitable to inheritance reuse.
- A new RPCTimeouts class that encapsulates the timeout
configuration as well as a per method cache of current timeout
values.
- A _TimeoutBackoffContext that supports using a RPCTimeout
instance to perform automatic backoff [2] when timeout is not
explicitly passed to prepare().
- A TimeoutBackoffRPCClient class that perpares instance of
_TimeoutBackoffContext. See docstring for sample usage.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-April/092914.html

commit_message:
WIP: Backing-off RPC Client/Context

DO NOT MERGE: This is a work in progress and needs additional
work. It's provided here as a WIP until oslo cores can agree on
the high level approach at which time docs, tests, etc. will be
added and additional testing done.

Background:
A while back we had a discussion on ML [1] regarding rehoming
some work done in neutron to implement a 'backing off RPC
Client' [2]. This patch implements that topic.

Implementation:
- Minor refactoring to base call context to support a more object
oriented approach suitable to inheritance reuse.
- A new RPCTimeouts class that encapsulates the timeout
configuration as well as a per method cache of current timeout
values.
- A _TimeoutBackoffContext that supports using a RPCTimeout
instance to perform automatic backoff [2] when timeout is not
explicitly passed to prepare().
- A TimeoutBackoffRPCClient class that perpares instance of
_TimeoutBackoffContext. See docstring for sample usage.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-April/092914.html
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/280595/

Change-Id: I675046e10a2b0cff20d9058752a84d975cd2588f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/22/407722/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import collections import logging import random import timefrom oslo_utils import excutilsfrom oslo_messaging._i18n import _LW, _LE _DEFAULT_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT = 60 default=_DEFAULT_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT,LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class TimeoutBackoffRPCClient(RPCClient): """Drop-in replacement for RPCClient that backs off on timeouts. This class can be used in place of RPCClient when consumers wish to backoff default timeout values on MessagingTimeout exceptions for RPC calls. It's based on the work in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/280595/ but also allows consumers to plug-in their own sleep/timeout functions in addition to capping the timeout with a timeout_ceiling. This implementation does not rely on a configuration, but rather allows consumers to get/set the default timeout via class methods. If consumers wish to use a different default, they need to call set_default_timeout() prior to any calls being made for TimeoutBackoffRPCClient instances. By default this implementation uses exponentially growing timeouts capping them via timeout_ceiling or if not specified by 10 * the default timeout. """ _METHOD_TIMEOUTS = collections.defaultdict( lambda: _DEFAULT_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT) def __init__(self, transport, target, version_cap=None, serializer=None, retry=None, splay_func=None, timeout_func=None, timeout_ceiling=None): """ :param transport: See RPCClient. :param target: See RPCClient. :param version_cap: See RPCClient. :param serializer: See RPCClient. :param retry: See RPCClient. :param splay_func: An optional function that's called to calculate the time to use for sleep() as a result of a MessagingTimeout. If not specified defaults to _default_splay(). :param timeout_func: An optional function that's called to calculate the next timeout value to use as a result of a MessagingTimeout. If not specified defaults _exponential_timeout(). :param timeout_ceiling: A maximum value to cap timeouts calculated for methods that timeout. """ # timeout kwarg removed as per method timeouts are tracked/used super(TimeoutBackoffRPCClient, self).__init__( transport, target, version_cap=version_cap, serializer=serializer, retry=retry) self._ceiling = timeout_ceiling self._splay_fn = splay_func or self._default_splay self._timeout_fn = timeout_func or self._exponential_timeout @property def timeout_ceiling(self): return self._ceiling or self.get_default_timeout() * 10 def _exponential_timeout(self, scoped_method, prev_timeout, default_timeout): return min(prev_timeout * 2, self.timeout_ceiling) def _default_splay(self, scoped_method, prev_timeout, next_timeout, default_timeout): return random.uniform(0, default_timeout) @classmethod def get_scoped_method_name(cls, method, context): return ('%s.%s' % (context.target.namespace, method) if context.target.namespace else method) @classmethod def set_default_timeout(cls, timeout): cls._METHOD_TIMEOUTS.default_factory = lambda: timeout @classmethod def get_default_timeout(cls): return cls._METHOD_TIMEOUTS.default_factory() def _get_timeout(self, method, context): return self._METHOD_TIMEOUTS[ self.get_scoped_method_name(method, context)] def call(self, ctxt, method, **kwargs): if 'timeout' in kwargs: return super(TimeoutBackoffRPCClient, self).call( ctxt, method, **kwargs) kwargs['timeout'] = self._get_timeout(method, ctxt) try: return super(TimeoutBackoffRPCClient, self).call( ctxt, method, kwargs) except exceptions.MessagingTimeout: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): scoped_method = self.get_scoped_method_name(method, ctxt) next_timeout = self._timeout_fn(scoped_method, kwargs['timeout'], self.get_default_timeout()) splay = self._splay_fn(scoped_method, kwargs['timeout'], next_timeout, self.get_default_timeout()) LOG.error(_LE("Timeout in RPC method %(method)s. Waiting for " "%(wait)s seconds before next attempt. If the " "server is not down, consider increasing the " "rpc_response_timeout option as Neutron " "server(s) may be overloaded and unable to " "respond quickly enough."), {'wait': int(round(splay)), 'method': scoped_method}) if next_timeout > kwargs['timeout']: LOG.warning(_LW("Increasing timeout for %(method)s calls " "to %(new)s seconds. Restart the agent to " "restore it to the default value."), {'method': scoped_method, 'new': next_timeout}) self._METHOD_TIMEOUTS[scoped_method] = next_timeout time.sleep(splay)

subject: Should send bytes message in kafka on Python 3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-11 06:36:53.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_kafka.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging/commit/2f0e80ef4d7fcb69b3cb488bd9feff93a0f831ac', 'message': "Should send bytes message in kafka on Python 3

There only bytes message is no need to dump, but if we don't dump str
it would send unicode message on Python 3(str is unicode on py3). so
let's replace str with six.binary_type.

ref:
https://github.com/dpkp/kafka-python/blob/master/kafka/producer/base.py#L396

"}]
commit_message:
Should send bytes message in kafka on Python 3

There only bytes message is no need to dump, but if we don't dump str
it would send unicode message on Python 3(str is unicode on py3). so
let's replace str with six.binary_type.

ref:
https://github.com/dpkp/kafka-python/blob/master/kafka/producer/base.py#L396

Change-Id: If6e4322468ff25c3d1afd46524ac576cb8cac95d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/63/291563/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Avoid keystone doctor token size warning
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-31 08:07:04.000000000', 'files': ['templates/keystone.conf.j2'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone/commit/d9a9a00a01eae79255f07eef19cdf869a50d8a1e', 'message': 'Avoid keystone doctor token size warning

Keystone doctor recommends setting the max_token_size.
Under Newton, keystone defaults are 8192.

This commit templates the multiple recommended sizes.

Ocata and above don't need the same logic, as the default
is now 255 (but another logic could be applied in a
different commit)

Here is an excerpt of a keystone doctor run:
"
WARNING: `keystone.conf [DEFAULT] max_token_size` should be adjusted.

This option is intended to protect keystone from unreasonably sized tokens,
where "reasonable" is mostly dependent on the `keystone.conf [token]
provider` that you're using. If you're using one of the following token
providers, then you should set `keystone.conf [DEFAULT] max_token_size`
accordingly:

- For UUID, set `keystone.conf [DEFAULT] max_token_size = 32`, because UUID
  tokens are always exactly 32 characters.

- For PKI and PKIZ, set `keystone.conf [DEFAULT] max_token_size = 8192`,
  because PKI and PKIZ tokens can be quite large, but any larger than 8192
  and they tend to break certain implementations of HTTP.

- For Fernet, set `keystone.conf [DEFAULT] max_token_size = 255`, because
  Fernet tokens should never exceed this length in most deployments.
  However, if you are also using `keystone.conf [identity] driver = ldap`,
  Fernet tokens may not be built using an efficient packing method,
  depending on the IDs returned from LDAP, resulting in longer Fernet
  tokens (adjust your `max_token_size` accordingly).
"

Change-Id: I3eee4b53d884674900807e48abe82fac97f77987
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid keystone doctor token size warning

Keystone doctor recommends setting the max_token_size.
Under Newton, keystone defaults are 8192.

This commit templates the multiple recommended sizes.

Ocata and above don't need the same logic, as the default
is now 255 (but another logic could be applied in a
different commit)

Here is an excerpt of a keystone doctor run:
"
WARNING: `keystone.conf [DEFAULT] max_token_size` should be adjusted.

This option is intended to protect keystone from unreasonably sized tokens,
where "reasonable" is mostly dependent on the `keystone.conf [token]
provider` that you're using. If you're using one of the following token
providers, then you should set `keystone.conf [DEFAULT] max_token_size`
accordingly:

- For UUID, set `keystone.conf [DEFAULT] max_token_size = 32`, because UUID
  tokens are always exactly 32 characters.

- For PKI and PKIZ, set `keystone.conf [DEFAULT] max_token_size = 8192`,
  because PKI and PKIZ tokens can be quite large, but any larger than 8192
  and they tend to break certain implementations of HTTP.

- For Fernet, set `keystone.conf [DEFAULT] max_token_size = 255`, because
  Fernet tokens should never exceed this length in most deployments.
  However, if you are also using `keystone.conf [identity] driver = ldap`,
  Fernet tokens may not be built using an efficient packing method,
  depending on the IDs returned from LDAP, resulting in longer Fernet
  tokens (adjust your `max_token_size` accordingly).
"

Change-Id: I3eee4b53d884674900807e48abe82fac97f77987
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone refs/changes/88/452088/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% if 'fernet' in keystone_token_provider %} max_token_size = 255 {% elif 'uuid' in keystone_token_provider %} max_token_size = 32 {% endif %}
