commit_message:
Scenarios manager: inline some not-so-used methods

In the spirit of reducing the size of the scenarios manager, we should
remove all the methods and functions that don"t really belong to the base
class. This patch removes the _update_router_admin_state and _log_net_info
methods.

Change-Id: I2ce28d6b46bd67cf4135ab56eb226e13d7b2b334

commit_message:
Fix updating images with repos

- Updating images fail because didn't find NODEPOOL_MIRROR_HOST
  variable.
- Remove .rpmsave files before we add new repository.

Change-Id: I41a5d1e0315d2635dfecfb70b51dace788bbfb0d

commit_message:
Fix return code when failing before launching the stack

Until now when a configuration error was detected early during the
pre-deployment verifications, the command would correctly return before
attempting to create/update the Heat stack, however the return code
would still show as '0', preventing scripts from picking up the
problem.

Change-Id: I8bd16e9753618e4c234440d7a6626e0ce4bd9972
Closes-Bug: #1672790

commit_message:
Retire os-cloud-config

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/114749.html

It was deprecated in Ocata, we want to remove it in Pike.
Nobody uses it now and the module is useless.
Let's remove it from OpenStack.

Change-Id: I3328297330fafd3681c46f60e12b296e992e2b5a
Related-Bug: #1677008

commit_message:
Made ironic-dsvm-standalone voting

This patch made gate-ironic-dsvm-standalone-ubuntu-xenial voting job
as it is stable enough.

Aslo drop duplicate job starting from Pike+
 * gate-tempest-dsvm-ironic-ipa-wholedisk-bios-pxe_ipmitool-tinyipa-ubuntu-xenial
 * gate-tempest-dsvm-ironic-ipa-partition-bios-agent_ipmitool-tinyipa-ubuntu-xenial
 * gate-tempest-dsvm-ironic-ipa-partition-bios-pxe_ipmitool-tinyipa-ubuntu-xenial

Still keep ironic-ipa-wholedisk-bios-agent_ipmitool-tinyipa as it is cross-project
job and launched on neutron/nova/devstack gates.
This job may be replaced by ironic-multinode in future if it is quick enough.

Change-Id: Idbc484cde01a3ea4533a3d887031fa3e1f603b79

commit_message:
Update ARA's Ansible version with releases for 2.1.x, 2.2.x and 2.3.x

Ansible recently released version 2.1.5.0 and 2.2.2.0.
There is also 2.3.0.0 which is currently in rc2.

-latest and 2.2.2.0 will both run 2.2.2.0 until 2.3.0.0 is released
but when 2.3 is released, -latest will pick it up automatically.

Change-Id: I98e922d7bf64a46ed231f4a075833db1cc6f9228

commit_message:
[Manila] Add 2 jobs for manila-image-elements project

For the moment, we have jobs that just build images for this
project, but they are not tested for usage with appropriate drivers.

So, add two tempest jobs, that will use built image with proposed
changes to "manila-image-elements" project and use it for manila
'generic' and 'container' (docker) drivers.

Add those jobs only to check pipeline and make them non-voting.

Change-Id: I3698044bbcaa94bddcfa192841520b4d7ea32016

commit_message:
Add a new project sushy-tools

This patch is adding a new project called "sushy-tools". This new
project will contain a set of tools to help with the development and
tests of the Sushy library.

Currently, these tools lives in the Sushy repository itself but they
have different requirements than the library itself (such as libvirt for
the simulator) so it makes sense to split it in another repository which
can be installed separately.

Needed-By: I880d9058408792f0c5d9f6531ae8ea06e06229ea
Change-Id: I2ff0299072e86dcf394e438ed2b6e443156a54e8

commit_message:
Uninstall postfix on nodes if it's there

centos installs this by default in centos-minimal. But we don't
need/want an MTA on our single-use nodes. So uninstall it.

Change-Id: Ib5fb99714d31ac8f52bac075eec70684c4220959

commit_message:
Skip pre-caching /deb- repositories in nodepool images

Building a nodepool image is incredibly slow due to the git repo
precaching and it doesn't help that everything is cached twice.

Change-Id: I665bda6cde29aea9ad5285d8d6981ad9c19fc5a7

commit_message:
Add separate ACL/group for castellan

The Barbican team would like to move Castellan under Oslo. This
change would help setup a group that includes both oslo and
barbican cores to take care of castellan

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/114335.html
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/barbican/2017/barbican.2017-03-20-20.00.txt

Depends-On: I571dc981a198fcde1a8bdf626ce159b860d452aa
Change-Id: I7928b922ad7a7519bf28041214ee50d3ca732a91

commit_message:
Add experimental murano functional test gate.

This gate will be used for running murano-ci functional tests
for openstack/murano repository only. It is meant as a replacement
for murano-ci, hosted on Mirantis servers, so that infra can
maintain the gate.

Initially it will be run in the experimental pipeline only. Once
the gates pass, they will be promoted to non-voting/voting.

Change-Id: Ibd043dbc656d95d470b709c4bae0c96d3625106f

commit_message:
Enable multinode topology for slow Patrole tests.

Multinode topology can be used to test migrate/evacuate server
tests, including other tests that require multiple hosts. These
should just be run on the slow tempest gate.

Change-Id: I876ec12b5f0c2c05842eaf355f695ccfa6e6f797

commit_message:
Tweak hooks for golang dsvm job

$BASE is not yet defined when the gate hooks are
registered, so we cannot check for the existence
of those files. Instead we check the existence of
files when the hooks are run. Also if the gate
hook is not defined then we do what is usually
done which is to run the devstack-vm-gate.sh script

Change-Id: I8e664f6633289a8514834598d72f82cc403497f4

deleted_lines: if [[ -f "$BASE/new/{name}/contrib/pre_test_hook.sh" ]]; then function pre_test_hook {{ }} export -f pre_test_hook fi if [[ -f "$BASE/new/{name}/contrib/gate_hook.sh" ]]; then function gate_hook {{ }} export -f gate_hook fi if [[ -f "$BASE/new/{name}/contrib/post_test_hook.sh" ]]; then function post_test_hook {{ source $BASE/new/{name}/contrib/post_test_hook.sh '{suite}' }} export -f post_test_hook fi

commit_message:
Remove gate-novaclient-dsvm-functional-mitaka-ubuntu-trusty-nv

This job only runs against master branch changes and uses
nova-network in a mitaka server configuration.

With change I8c520100a0016eed3959619c71dae037ebd72939, novaclient
will no longer work with a nova-network backed server, so it
no longer serves a purpose.

Change-Id: I63b36fb8acc5c9a273e6adcb271df16d0f71031e

commit_message:
Add validation for security_groups parameter in Port

Currently, we check whether specified value in list
matches with UUID format or not.
However, we don't check whether data type of specified value of
security_groups key is list in the first place.
This patch adds check above.

Change-Id: If027df3ff34b219e4a043934b9461ac0fcb40156
Closes-Bug: #1477921

commit_message:
[rally] Add support for rally-branching

Two latest Rally releases should support backporting bug-fixes.
Since Rally releases do not relate to OpenStack branches, we
want to test them along with latest devstack.

Change-Id: I470d89d06a35d38ee9f085bb2d3a8fc543cf0347

commit_message:
Differentiate between dpkg and rpm for libssl-dev

The libssl-dev package was registered in bindep.txt for both
dpkg and rpm platforms. This patch makes it use:
* libssl-dev [platform:dpkg]
* openssl-devel [platform:rpm]

Change-Id: I4a0982bf2052e193ba48c98f1b38ae569fa41be8
Closes-Bug: 1676497

commit_message:
Remove obsolete comments and usage

We do not build and translate docbook XML anymore, so do not need
Generatedocbook anymore. Remove the now obsolete comment and also the
sitepackages usage that was only needed for these.

Change-Id: I383a09b557f67bf490f9bfa4b9e30ebe416d95ac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/49/452549/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/87/452587/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: referencing the old release. Do one patch per book, and record the review number in the release etherpad so that release managers can review easily. For versioned books, these patches should have a core -2 review on them until they are ready to be published at release time. For continuously released books, these patches can be merged immediately. In some versioned guides, the master branch will link to draft books in some locations. Most notably, the basic Installation Tutorial links to the additional services Installation Guides in ``doc/install-guide/source/additional-services.rst``. A patch will need to be created to update these to the correct version before the book is published.
deleted_lines: referencing the old release. Do one patch per book, record the review number in the release etherpad so that release managers can review easily. For versioned books, these patches should have a core -2 review on them until they are ready to be published at release time. For continuously released books, these patches can be merged immediately.

commit_message:
Add a StackDefinition class

This defines clearly the API through which Template/Function plugins
may access data about the stack. That allows us to ensure that we don't
accidentally access data in a highly inefficient manner, and third-party
plugin developers to have confidence that the interface they're using is
stable and won't change without a multi-cycle deprecation process with
ample warning.

Change-Id: I7a67700685770d6d5b9c811e72a8b21221400092
Partially-Implements: blueprint stack-definition

commit_message:
Remove the usage of extension black/white list opt in config drive

The Nova API doesn't support the extension anymore. The API
unittest shouldn't disable any part of Nova API. This patch
removes the tests which disable part of API in config drive
unittests.

Partial-implement-blueprint api-no-more-extensions-pike

Change-Id: I91e10fa26f44d8932926c2258c41fb7ede48f5b5

added_lines: This section explains SFC Encapsulation support in networking-sfc. The link to Launchpad at [4] is an umbrella for SFC Encapsulation work with the> The SFC Encapsulation provides, at a minimum, SFP identification, and is used > by the SFC-aware functions, such as the SFF and SFC-aware SFs. The SFC > encapsulation is not used for network packet forwarding. In addition to SFP > identification, the SFC Encapsulation carries metadata including data-plane > context information.parameter, inside the ``sfc_service_function_params`` table:: keyword='correlation' value='mpls' pair_id=PORT_PAIR_UUID(when supported). rule (taken from one of the SFC OVS agent's unit tests):: 1. *pp_corr=mpls and every next_hop's pp_corr=mpls*2. *pp_corr=mpls and every next_hop's pp_corr=None*3. *pp_corr=None and every next_hop's pp_corr=mpls*4. *pp_corr=None and every next_hop's pp_corr=None*
deleted_lines: Launchpad blueprint/RFE: https://bugs.launchpad.net/networking-sfc/+bug/1587486 This document explains SFC Encapsulation support in networking-sfc. This is not a blueprint specification (spec). The link to Launchpad above is an umbrella for SFC Encapsulation work with the"The SFC Encapsulation provides, at a minimum, SFP identification, and is used by the SFC-aware functions, such as the SFF and SFC-aware SFs. The SFC encapsulation is not used for network packet forwarding. In addition to SFP identification, the SFC Encapsulation carries metadata including data-plane context information."parameter, inside the ``sfc_service_function_params`` table: ``keyword='correlation'`` ``value='mpls'`` ``pair_id=PORT_PAIR_UUID`` (when supported).rule (taken from one of the SFC OVS agent's unit tests). ::1. pp_corr=mpls and every next_hop's pp_corr=mpls2. pp_corr=mpls and every next_hop's pp_corr=None3. pp_corr=None and every next_hop's pp_corr=mpls4. pp_corr=None and every next_hop's pp_corr=None

removes the tests which disable part of API in multiple create
unittests.

added_lines: def _test_create_extra(self, params, no_image=False): server = self.controller.create(self.req, body=body).obj['server']
deleted_lines: CONF.set_override('extensions_blacklist', 'os-multiple-create', 'osapi_v21') self.no_mult_create_controller = servers_v21.ServersController( extension_info=ext_info) def _test_create_extra(self, params, no_image=False, override_controller=None): if override_controller: server = override_controller.create(self.req, body=body).obj['server'] else: server = self.controller.create(self.req, body=body).obj['server'] def _check_multiple_create_extension_disabled(self, **kwargs): # NOTE: on v2.1 API, "create a server" API doesn't add the following # attributes into kwargs when non-loading multiple_create extension. # However, v2.0 API adds them as values "1" instead. So we need to # define checking methods for each API here. self.assertNotIn('min_count', kwargs) self.assertNotIn('max_count', kwargs) def test_create_instance_with_multiple_create_disabled(self): min_count = 2 max_count = 3 params = { multiple_create_v21.MIN_ATTRIBUTE_NAME: min_count, multiple_create_v21.MAX_ATTRIBUTE_NAME: max_count, } old_create = compute_api.API.create def create(*args, **kwargs): self._check_multiple_create_extension_disabled(**kwargs) return old_create(*args, **kwargs) self.stub_out('nova.compute.api.API.create', create) self._test_create_extra( params, override_controller=self.no_mult_create_controller)

commit_message:
Be strict about QoS models construct parameters

The change makes the parameters passed to QoS model's constructors
strict in the sense that non-existent fields are not passed.

Change-Id: I85f169e6230ae8da4b7b74ce57082a1f7d6efc7c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/43/450843/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import copy from dragonflow.db.models import qos def qos_rule_from_neutron_qos_rule(rule): if isinstance(rule, dict): rule_dict = copy.copy(rule) else: rule_dict = rule.to_dict() rule_dict.pop('qos_policy_id', None) return qos.QosPolicyRule(**rule_dict) def qos_policy_from_neutron_qos_policy(policy): policy_dict = { 'id': policy['id'], 'topic': policy['project_id'], 'name': policy['name'], 'version': policy['revision_number'], } rules = policy.get('rules') if rules: policy_dict['rules'] = [qos_rule_from_neutron_qos_rule(rule) for rule in rules] return qos.QosPolicy(**policy_dict)

commit_message:
Added script to cleanup the orphaned volumes

The script removes all the unused volumes which are not attached to
any container.

Closes-Bug: #1531407

Change-Id: If5be46c92b2c54e94f65e78f566caed0bb49c7cf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/57/374557/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash volumes_to_remove=$(docker volume ls -qf dangling=true) echo "Removing unused volumes ..." (docker volume rm ${volumes_to_remove} 2>&1) > /dev/null echo "Volumes cleaned up!"

commit_message:
l2pop to always notify flood entries to agents

During bulk vm migrations and vm autoevacuations between nodes,
sometimes flood entries in nodes are not created preventing vms
communication.
This is because, Neutron server will identify first or last port
on the network on that agent, and will notify flood entries accordingly.
But when multiple workers are enabled, this identification fails
in server and server can't properly notify agents for flood entries.
Change [1] will address this issue by moving this logic to agents.
But that creates a dependency between neutron server and ovs agent
(Old agents from previous releases still have this issue.)

So Always notifying flood entries to agents may avoid flood entries
loss. As we are not changing RPC between neutron server and ovs agents,
this can work for agents from previous relase.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/269212/

Partial-Bug: #1555600
Change-Id: I3c6d90ddc2ffd344815279e57a2d839579b9d8e7

commit_message:
Allow any port or protocol in security group rules

Neutron allows setting port or protocol wildcard by not specifying any value
for them.

Example, these are allowed by neutron:

    neutron security-group-rule-create --direction egress <sgid>
    neutron security-group-rule-create --direction egress --protocol tcp <sgid>

Specifying '-1' for IP protocol means a wildcard IP protocol.
validate_ip_protocol is updated accordingly.

'All ports' choice is added to 'Open Port' field.

Change-Id: I4a7262eda89e3206c743fee14c78aa6b49308ce6
Closes-Bug: 1669467

commit_message:
Add splay option to offset polling intervals

When the os-collect-config process is started on multiple systems at the
same time, the polling intervals can line up to cause performance
problems against the configuration source. To reduce the impact, this
change adds a splay option to allow the operator to configure a random
delay prior to the polling to attempt to offset the polling
syncronization.

Change-Id: I1a8be3345d783da9014eca7ea26da19d57e767c0
Closes-Bug: #1677314

commit_message:
Add 'run' attribute to create action

commit_message:
Support profile-only to cluster update

This path revises cluster-update command.
The command could support 'profile-only' parameter.
partial-blueprint: add-profile-only-to-cluster-update

Change-Id: Ibf2e4d67abe76b92a508a3e22e5c528d53cde5a4
Signed-off-by: chohoor <chohoor@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-senlinclient refs/changes/49/436349/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @utils.arg('-P', '--profile-only', metavar='<BOOLEAN>', default=False, help=_("Whether the cluster should be updated profile only. " "If false, it will be applied to all existing nodes. " "If true, any newly created nodes will use the new profile, " "but existing nodes will not be changed. Default is False.")) 'profile_only': strutils.bool_from_string(args.profile_only, strict=True),

commit_message:
Include panko in the default dispatcher

panko is enabled by default, we might as well make it
the default dispatcher along with gnocchi.

Closes-bug: #1676900

commit_message:
Deprecate os-interface proxy API

This should have been part of the "Deprecate API Proxies" spec but we missed
it. This is essentially the same spec but for the os-interface API which is a
proxy to Neutron for listing and showing ports for a given server.

APIImpact

Spec for blueprint deprecate-os-interface

Change-Id: If4a57cd38b94c867c2cb1b9e70c87a74432da69c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/77/350277/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================ Deprecate os-interface proxy API ================================ https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/deprecate-os-interface This should have been part of the `Deprecate API Proxies`_ spec but we missed it. This is essentially the same spec but for the os-interface API which is a proxy to Neutron for listing and showing ports for a given server. Problem description =================== The 2.36 microversion deprecated the proxy APIs for images (glance), volumes (cinder), baremetal (ironic) and networking (neutron/nova-network). When making requests to those APIs with microversion>=2.36 they will fail with a 404 response. The os-interface API was missed during that work so this fills that gap with a new microversion but using the same model/behavior as the 2.36 microversion. Use Cases --------- - As a Nova maintainer, I do not want to maintain proxy APIs to other services and resources that do not live in Nova. - As an end-user of an OpenStack cloud, I do not want to be confused by being able to get the same resources from different endpoints in the service catalog. Proposed change =============== The API Ref site will be updated to state that the ``os-interface`` GET methods are deprecated. The documentation for all of these will be moved to the end of the API Ref site, and it will be visually clear this is part of the deprecated portion of the API. There will also be links to the correct corresponding parts of the documentation for the relevant APIs. .. note:: The POST and DELETE methods of the os-interface API will not be deprecated as those are actions on a server resource to attach/detach ports. It should be noted, however, that currently the POST (interfaceAttachment action) API implementation calls to Neutron to show the port to send back in the response. Since we plan to 404 on the GET (show) method, we will need to handle this either by calling neutronclient.show_port directly from the create method or using the instance.info_cache which has the port details after the port is attached to the instance. It should also be noted that this spec does not intend to deprecate the ``os-virtual-interfaces`` API which is (a) was not deprecated in 2.36 even though it is a network API and (b) currently only works when using nova-network. The os-virtual-interfaces API gets infromation from the virtual_interfaces table in the nova database. With the 2.32 microversion we started populating that table for Neutron ports also, therefore there are future plans to update this API to work for Neutron also since it would be useful to get virtual device tags for those VIFs from that API (which is not available in Neutron). That work would not happen in Neutron, it would be an API improvement for Ocata. Alternatives ------------ Keep these proxies forever. This will increase the cost of the maintenance of Nova and slow down our ability to adapt to new features and requirements. Given we have already merged the 2.36 microversion this alternative does not really exist for us anymore though. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- This change will be done in concert with an API microversion, after which all GET requests to the os-interface API will return a ``404``. This is a ``404`` because we are removing the whole resource in all of these cases. Other suggestions of ``400`` are not appropriate, because that's almost never appropriate for GET (because how did you malform that request), and ``405`` is not appropriate because the resource doesn't exist at all (``405`` is for a /resource that some verbs work on, but others do not). There is no impact to nova-network users as the os-interface API never worked for nova-network anyway. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- The ``nova interface-list`` CLI will be deprecated as well, and we'll plan to remove that in the first major python-novaclient release after Nova 15.0.0 is released. Performance Impact ------------------ This should reduce some load on Nova once these APIs are gone, as users will go and directly hit the native APIs they need to access. Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: mriedem Work Items ---------- * Updated API Ref site with os-interface GET requests as deprecated. * Introduce microversion to trigger 404 on GET requests to os-interface. * python-novaclient change to deprecate the ``interface-list`` CLI and API. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= There will be in-tree functional testing that these APIs do the right thing after this microversion and return 404s. For Tempest, the AttachInterfacesTestJSON test will either need to be capped at the microversion or changed to use Neutron APIs for listing/showing ports for the given server by filtering ports on the device_id (server.uuid) or port uuid, respectively. There are `ongoing discussions`_ on how to handle this in the openstack-dev mailing list. Documentation Impact ==================== The compute api-ref_ documentation will be updated to note that the os-interface proxy APIs for listing and showing ports for a given server are deprecated. References ========== .. _Deprecate API Proxies: deprecate-api-proxies.html .. _ongoing discussions: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-July/100085.html .. _api-ref: http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#port-interfaces-servers-os-interface History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Newton - Introduced

commit_message:
Support multiple messages from delete_stack

This updates the workflow wrapper to use the multiple message interface.

NOTE: the test for this patch use the fake websocket that was updated in
a previous patch, so while this code is tested, no test updates were
needed for this change.

Change-Id: I6f6b09589646b6eaf5811fdf23558c949fbbc2b8
Partial-Bug: #1646887
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/36/446436/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for payload in base.wait_for_messages(workflow_client, ws, execution): if payload['status'] != "SUCCESS": raise InvalidConfiguration(payload['message'])
